0.title: Delhi Airport express line to get 2-km extension, operational from Sept
0.article_body: The 2-km extension of Delhi Metro's Airport Express Line to the Dwarka sub-city will become operational from September. Train trial runs are being held on the stretch between the existing Sector 21 station and the new India International Convention Centre station in Sector 25. The effectiveness of signalling systems is tested during the trial runs, according to DMRC officials.

1.title: Realtor shot dead in Hyderabad, 3 arrested for murder within 24 hrs
1.article_body: Three persons were arrested in the murder case of a realtor who was shot dead in Hyderabad's Madhapur on Monday, police tweeted on Tuesday. The accused were identified as 50-year-old Mohammed Mujahed alias Mujju, 25-year-old Mohammed Jeelani Pasha and 31-year-old Mohammed Firoz Khan. Police recovered two country-made pistols, seven live cartridges, one knife, a car and a two-wheeler from them.

2.title: PIL filed in Delhi HC seeking ban on flying, manufacturing kites
2.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) was filed in Delhi HC seeking Centre and Delhi government to impose a ban on manufacturing and flying kites. The petition stated that several persons and birds are killed due to accidents caused by kite strings. Last month, a man died after a kite string slit his throat while commuting on his bike in Delhi.

3.title: India defeat Canada 3-2, reach women's hockey semi-finals at CWG 2022
3.article_body: India defeated Canada 3-2 in their last Pool A match in women's hockey event at CWG 2022. With this, India qualified for the semi-finals. India are placed second in their group with three victories from four matches. India defeated Ghana, Wales and Canada in the group stage, while their only defeat came against England.

4.title: No history of contact between cases of monkeypox in Delhi: Report
4.article_body: There's no history of contact between the two Nigerian nationals who tested positive in Delhi for monkeypox and two other suspected cases, The Indian Express reported. All four have been living in different areas of Delhi and don't have any history of international travel either. However, all five monkeypox cases reported from Kerala had travelled to the UAE.

5.title: Uber to allow Delhi-NCR residents book ride via chatbot on WhatsApp
5.article_body: WhatsApp and Uber have announced their WhatsApp to Ride (WA2R) partnership for residents in Delhi-NCR. The feature will allow people to book a ride with Uber using WhatsApp chatbot. The service is available in both English and Hindi languages. In December 2021, the two companies successfully ran a pilot project in Lucknow.

6.title: Rupee not collapsing but finding its natural course: Sitharaman
6.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that the Indian Rupee was not "collapsing" but finding its natural course. The Rupee has depreciated against the USD but its performance is still better than the currencies of other countries, she said. "We have withstood the impact of the US Fed's decisions much better than any other peer currencies," she added.

7.title: ₹3.35-cr assets of former B'luru corporator attached in DA case
7.article_body: Former Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike corporator G C Gowramma's assets worth ₹3.35 crore have been attached by the Enforcement Directorate in a disproportionate assets (DA) case. The attached properties include farm land, residential and commercial sites. The money laundering case was made after the Karnataka Lokayukta filed a chargesheet against the former Azad Nagar corporator.

8.title: Mumbai Police arrest 2 homeless men in state-wide bike theft racket
8.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two homeless men, Babasaheb Kharat and Shankar Magre, for stealing motorcycles from Mumbai and selling them in Maharashtra's Aurangabad and Buldhana, officials said on Wednesday. Nine stolen motorcycles were recovered from them. Police said they were investigating a case where a motorcycle was stolen from a service road next to Western Express highway on July 2.

9.title: Guj HC grants bail to 'totally disabled' man accused of raping 8-yr-old girl
9.article_body: The Gujarat High Court on June 29 granted bail to a man accused of raping an eight-year-old girl on grounds of the man not being in a "fit state of mind" and suffering from "moderate mental retardation". The accused had allegedly inserted needles in the survivor's rectum and had threatened to kill the child if the child informed her parents.

10.title: Shiv Sena leader, friend booked for criminal intimidation & rape
10.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered an FIR against Shiv Sena's new Thane district chief Kedar Dighe and his friend Rohit Kapoor for alleged criminal intimidation and rape. Rohit allegedly raped the victim, following which Dighe called the victim and threatened her with dire consequences if she approached the authorities against Rohit, reports said.

11.title: Removed from power for publishing map including Kalapani: Ex-Nepal PM
11.article_body: Ex-Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli has claimed that he was removed from power after his government published a new map of the country that included Kalapani, Limpiyadhura and Lipulekh as its territories. Notably, India lays claim to these regions. Nepal's Supreme Court had ordered Sher Bahadur Deuba to replace Oli as the country's new PM last year.

12.title: Govt withdraws Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019
12.article_body: The government on Wednesday withdrew the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019 from the Lok Sabha. The Bill, which was introduced on December 11, 2019, was intended to provide for a law for protection of personal data. Stating that a comprehensive legal framework is being worked upon, the government proposed to present a new bill.

13.title: 3 militants of Karbi United Liberation Army held in Assam, arms seized
13.article_body:
Three militants, including the self-styled chairman of the Karbi United Liberation Army, were arrested from Assam's Karbi Anglong district and arms and ammunition were recovered from them.
Police said that a member of the outfit was also injured in an encounter with police. District police launched the operation based on intelligence input, Pushpraj Singh, SP of Karbi Anglong district, said.

14.title: China suspends some trade with Taiwan 1 day after Pelosi's visit
14.article_body: China has suspended trade of selected goods with Taiwan one day after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to the island nation. China's General Administration of Customs said import of some fishes and fruits from Taiwan has been banned due to excessive pesticide residue detected "multiple times" on products since last year. Export of natural sand has also been suspended.

15.title: India register wins in sectional matches in men's singles, women's pairs in lawn bowls
15.article_body: Indian lawn bowls player Mridul Borgohain has won his second round in the men's singles at the ongoing CWG 2022. Meanwhile, Lovely Choubey and Nayanmoni Saikia have also registered a win in their second round in the women's pairs category. Mridul and the women's pairs team will have their next-round games later today.

16.title: PCMC to fine big societies for non-functional sewage treatment plants
16.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) will impose fines on big residential societies if the sewage treatment plants (STP) there are found to be non-functional. "We have already served notices to several housing societies to get their STPs in order. If they don't act in the next one month, we will cut off their drainage lines," a civic body official said.

17.title: 31-yr-old NGO operator, aide caught red-handed while selling newborn in H'yana
17.article_body: A 31-year-old NGO operator and her 34-year-old accomplice were caught red-handed while selling a one-month-old girl for ₹1 lakh in Haryana's Faridabad, police said. They used to take kids from poor families on promise of giving them a better upbringing and then sell them, according to police. The SI and ASI, posing as a childless couple, contacted the accused.

18.title: Vistara starts flight operations between Mumbai and Jeddah
18.article_body: Vistara has started flight operations on the Mumbai-Jeddah route three times a week with the inaugural flight taking off at 6.05 pm on Tuesday, the airline said. CEO Vinod Kannan said, "Given the multitude of upcoming futuristic projects in Saudi Arabia, strong trade ties with India and presence of large Indian diaspora, there is growing traffic between the two countries."

19.title: Over 34,000 women serving in CAPFs: Govt tells Rajya Sabha
19.article_body: Over 34,000 women are currently serving in Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs), government informed the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. Of these, 9,454 women are serving in CRPF, followed by 7,391 in BSF and 9,320 in CISF, said MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai. He further informed that facilities like creches and daycare centres have also been provided to women employees.

20.title: India’s services sector growth hits 4-month low in July
20.article_body: The S&P Global India Services PMI Business Activity Index fell from 59.2 in June to 55.5 in July as inflation, unfavourable weather and competitive pressures restricted demand. The index pointed to the slowest growth rate in four months. Meanwhile, the growth in sales was driven by the domestic market even as international demand saw a decline.

21.title: Bengal CM Mamata reshuffles cabinet, Babul Supriyo, 8 more take oath as ministers
21.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee reshuffled her cabinet on Wednesday. Nine ministers including Babul Supriyo, Snehasis Chakraborty, Partha Bhowmick, Udayan Guha, Pradip Mazumdar, Tajmul Hossain, Satyajit Barman, Birbaha Hansda and Biplab Roy Chowdhury took oath in Kolkata today. Birbaha Hansda and Biplab Roy Chowdhury were sworn in as ministers with independent charges.

22.title: MI cricketer Kumar Kartikeya meets his family after 9 years and 3 months, shares pic
22.article_body: Mumbai Indians spinner Kumar Kartikeya met his family after nine years and three months. The 24-year-old took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with his mother and wrote, "Unable to express my feelings." Kartikeya, who made his MI debut in IPL 2022, had earlier said, "I'd decided to return home only when I achieve something in life."

23.title: US issues worldwide alert for its citizens after Al-Qaeda leader's killing
23.article_body: The US State Department has issued a worldwide alert to its citizens after the death of Al-Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri. "Following al-Zawahiri's death, supporters of [Al-Qaeda]...may seek to attack US facilities, personnel, or citizens," it said. "US citizens are strongly encouraged to maintain...vigilance and practice good situational awareness when travelling abroad," the caution read.

24.title: He plays high-risk shots better than everyone: Parthiv on Suryakumar's 76
24.article_body: Discussing batter Suryakumar Yadav's 76 off 44 balls in the third T20I against West Indies, ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said he executes high-risk shots better than everyone. "If a player can hit you over fine leg and also over long off and covers, then he's the most difficult batter to bowl to...That's the kind of batter Suryakumar is," he added.

25.title: I'd drop Shreyas, play Harshal in place of Avesh for 4th WI T20I: Parthiv
25.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has suggested Team India to drop Shreyas Iyer and include Ravindra Jadeja in the playing XI for the fourth T20I against West Indies. He also suggested playing Harshal Patel, if he's fit, in place of Avesh Khan. The 37-year-old further said that India should promote Deepak Hooda to bat at the number three position.

26.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank appoints Milind Nagnur as President and CTO
26.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank has announced the appointment of Milind Nagnur as President and Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Nagnur, who had been working at US-based Early Warning as CTO since June 2020, will be incharge of spearheading Kotak's technological transformation. Nagnur has previously worked with Wells Fargo Bank, JP Morgan Chase and Citigroup.

27.title: Only 342 liquor shops across 17 zones to operate in Delhi this month
27.article_body: A day after Delhi Lt Governor VK Saxena approved the extension of liquor licence by a month, six more zonal licensees exited the liquor business, leading to closure of 126 more shops. So, for August, there will be only 342 operational liquor shops located across 17 zones in the national capital. Until July 31, Delhi had 468 active liquor shops.

28.title: Assam MLA protests against decision to teach maths, science in English
28.article_body: Raijor Dal president Akhil Gogoi on Wednesday staged a sit-in protest in Assam's Guwahati against the state government's decision to teach maths and science in English in schools from Class 3 onwards. "The decisions to impart education in English in vernacular schools...not provincialising any schools in future are directly related to the future of the Assamese society," Gogoi said.

29.title: Congress no longer a party of Rajiv Gandhi, Indira Gandhi: Bishnoi
29.article_body: Haryana Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi, after handing his resignation letter to state Assembly Speaker said he will work in BJP as an ordinary worker. "Congress is no longer the party of Rajiv Gandhi and Indira Gandhi," Bishnoi added. "We need to strengthen work done by CM Manohar Lal Khattar," he said earlier. Bishnoi is set to join BJP on Thursday.

30.title: Over 500 toilets meant for PwD can be used by transgenders: Delhi govt tells HC
30.article_body: The Delhi government has informed the Delhi High Court that 505 toilets meant for persons with disabilities (PwD) have been designated for the use of transgenders. Creation of separate toilets for use of transgenders will be done on a fast-track basis and  nine new toilets have already been constructed for their use, the Delhi government told the High Court.

31.title: Deeply apprehensive of implications: Opposition on SC's verdict on ED's powers
31.article_body: As many as 17 Opposition parties signed a joint statement over the Supreme Court's decision to uphold the Enforcement Directorate's powers under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002. "We place on record our deep apprehension on the long-term implications of SC's judgement...without examining whether some of these amendments could have been enacted by way of Finance Act," they wrote.

32.title: All negativity around 'Laal...' has been curated by Aamir Khan: Kangana
32.article_body: Following a Twitter trend calling for the boycott of Aamir Khan's film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Kangana Ranaut reacted on Instagram saying, "All the negativity...[has been] skilfully curated by mastermind Aamir ji himself." "Even after Aamir...made Hinduphobic 'PK'...he gave...[his] biggest hits...please stop making it about religion...it takes away from their bad acting," added Kangana.

33.title: Why not start discussion on freebies with ending perks of MPs: Varun Gandhi
33.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Wednesday said there should be a discussion on pension and perks of MPs before questioning freebies given to the public. "Before pointing fingers at...relief given to the public, we should look within," Varun tweeted while referring to BJP leader Sushil Modi's notice in the Rajya Sabha demanding a discussion on "ending the culture of freebies".

34.title: Duo kidnaps 13-yr-old boy for ransom, kills him in Mumbai; arrested
34.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly kidnapping and killing a 13-year-old boy in Mumbai's Kashimira. The duo told the boy they would give him a phone and took him to a green patch at Waliv, where they stabbed him to death. They later demanded a ransom of ₹25 lakh from his mother, who earns by singing at restaurants and bars.

35.title: Executing agencies for 15 new bridges in Hyderabad finalised
35.article_body: The Telangana government finalised the executing agencies for the construction of 15 new bridges in Hyderabad across the Musi and Esa rivers. The construction would be divided between four agencies. The bridges would be made independently across the rivers for the development of surrounding areas and because existing bridges are unable to handle the increased traffic load.

36.title: Weightlifter Lovepreet Singh breaks his own national record, bags bronze at CWG 2022
36.article_body: India's 24-year-old weightlifter Lovepreet Singh lifted a total of 355 kg in the men's 109-kg final to bag a bronze medal at CWG 2022. He also broke his own national record. Lovepreet lifted 163 kg in snatch and 192 kg in clean and jerk. India have now won 14 medals at CWG 2022 so far, with nine coming from weightlifting.

37.title: US House Speaker Pelosi departs from Taiwan amid China tensions
37.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, who arrived in Taiwan on Tuesday, has departed from the country after meeting President Tsai Ing-wen earlier today. Pelosi, who pledged US' solidarity and cooperation with Taiwan during her visit, is the highest ranking US official to visit Taiwan in 25 years. Notably, her visit came amid warnings from China threatening consequences over the move.

38.title: Gati Shakti University will solve transport sector's complexities: Railways Min
38.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that transport sector is complex and Gati Shakti University is needed to handle such complex system. "The university will focus on five areas including transport-based courses, skill development, applied research, technology development, and transport economics," he said in Parliament. On Monday, Gati Shakti University Bill was introduced in the Lok Sabha.

39.title: Pelosi's Taiwan trip an attempt to irritate China: Russia's Lavrov
39.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov said that US House Speaker Pelosi's visit to Taiwan is America's deliberate attempt to irritate China. Lavrov, who is on a visit to Myanmar, said that he can see no other reason to create such an annoyance almost out of the blue. China, that considers Taiwan a part of its own territory, condemned Pelosi's visit.

40.title: Former Amazon executive Pankaj Jathar becomes Etsy India's VP
40.article_body: Pankaj Jathar, former top executive of Amazon, has been appointed as Etsy India's Vice President and Country Head. In a statement, company said that Jathar will lead Etsy's India business to scale its marketplace capabilities further. He will also focus on using Etsy marketplace to connect sellers in creative community to millions of buyers around the world.

41.title: Don't understand how my name is on Brahmastra's Wikipedia page: Divyenndu
41.article_body: Actor Divyenndu said he doesn't understand how his name is on the Wikipedia page of 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva'. When asked about his experience of working with Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt in the film, Divyenndu said, "It's fake news...Maybe for a sequel. I don't deny but not for this one." The film is directed by Ayan Mukerji.

42.title: Locals pelt bricks at police as they arrest Jahangirpuri riots accused
42.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a man wanted in the Jahangirpuri communal violence case. Police said Jahangirpuri locals tried to help the accused and pelted bricks at a head constable to prevent the arrest. The arrested man, 29-year-old Sanwar Malik, is accused of instigating violence during the Hanuman Jayanti celebration in April and pelting stones at people, including police officers.

43.title: Shiv Sena's Thane chief booked for threatening woman raped by friend
43.article_body: Shiv Sena's Thane district unit head, Kedar Dighe, has been booked for reportedly threatening a 23-year-old woman who was allegedly raped by his friend at a hotel in Lower Parel. "Dighe first told the woman not to go to the police and settle the matter by accepting money. When [she] didn't budge, Dighe allegedly threatened her for life," police said.

44.title: Former Andhra CM NTR's daughter cremated in Hyderabad
44.article_body: The last rites of K Uma Maheswari, the youngest daughter of former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister NT Rama Rao, were performed in Hyderabad on Wednesday. The funeral was attended by her brother-in-law and former CM N Chandrababu Naidu, brother and actor N Balakrishna and other family members. Maheswari was found dead at her Jubilee Hills residence on Monday.

45.title: I'll inform my fans when time is right: Raj Anadkat on reports of quitting 'Taarak...'
45.article_body: Actor Raj Anadkat, who plays Tapu in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has reacted to the reports that suggest he is quitting the show. "My fans, my audience, my well-wishers, they all know that I am...good at creating suspense," he said. Raj added, "Whatever it is, I'll update my fans. When the time is right, everyone will get to know."

46.title: BMC invites tenders for upgradation of 400 km of roads in next 2 yrs
46.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has invited five tenders for upgradation and improvement of about 400 km of roads at an estimated cost of ₹5,800 crore. The road works are to be completed within 24 months and the liability period of the work will be 10 years. All these roads will be constructed with cement concrete.

47.title: Bodies of sisters aged 6 & 11 found holding hands after being killed in K'taka landslide
47.article_body: Two sisters, aged 6 and 11, who were found holding their hands were killed after they were trapped in their house following a landslide in Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka. The bodies of the sisters were found after a lengthy search operation. Rescue personnel couldn't reach the spot immediately as a tree fell on the way and water was overflowing.

48.title: PM's message didn't reach his family: Congress to RSS on Tiranga campaign
48.article_body: Congress criticised RSS for not changing its display picture amid 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and said, "We are putting DP of our leader Nehru with tricolour...But the Prime Minister's message does not seem to have reached his family." Sharing screenshots of profile pictures of RSS and its chief Mohan Bhagwat, Pawan Khera said, "Sangh people, at least now adopt tricolor."

49.title: MP Manoj Tiwari apologises for not wearing helmet during 'Tiranga bike rally'
49.article_body: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari took to his Twitter to apologise for not wearing a helmet during the 'Tiranga bike rally' held on Wednesday morning. He also said he would pay the challan for violating the traffic rule. He urged people not to drive two-wheelers without a helmet with a message that their friends and family need them.

50.title: Loudspeakers till 12 am for 5 days during Ganesh Utsav in Pune: CM Shinde
50.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde announced mandals will be permitted to play loudspeakers until midnight for five days instead of the usual four days during the Ganesh festival in Pune. Moreover, Shinde also asked the Pune Police to give five-year permission to the mandals to erect pandals through a one-window system. Currently, they apply for permission every year.

51.title: Suspended Cong MLAs part of conspiracy to topple J'khand govt: WB CID
51.article_body: West Bengal's Crime Investigation Department (CID) on Tuesday claimed that the three Jharkhand Congress MLAs arrested with ₹49 lakh were "part of a conspiracy to topple" the Jharkhand government, The Indian Express reported. CID strongly suspects "their indirect links with Assam CM through an influential person close to the BJP-led Centre". "We've found their links," a senior CID officer said.

52.title: Shares of Godrej Properties trade lower a day after Q1 results
52.article_body: A day after Godrej Properties declared its earnings for the quarter ended June, its shares were trading lower by over 3% intraday on the BSE on Wednesday. The real estate developer had reported a 154% year-on-year growth in consolidated profit at ₹43.3 crore and revenue surged 184%. Its Q1FY22 earnings were hit by the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.

53.title: Robinhood cuts 23% of staff, Co-Founder says 'this is on me'
53.article_body: Robinhood will fire 23% of its workforce three months after it announced to slash 9% of its full-time staff. In a blogpost, Robinhood's CEO and Co-founder Vlad Tenev took responsibility for the apparent over-hiring in 2021. "We are operating with more staffing than appropriate. This is on me," Tenev said. During April layoffs, the company was left with 3,100 employees.

54.title: 2 youths shoot Delhi jeweller in face, steal ₹25,000 from shop; held
54.article_body: Two youths shot a 46-year-old jeweller in face with a country-made pistol and made off with ₹25,000 from his silver jewellery shop in Delhi's Najafgarh area on Tuesday. Three hours later, the accused, who claimed to be 17 years old, were arrested during an encounter with Dwarka Police. The victim, Rajesh, is in a stable condition following a surgery.

55.title: MP man, out on bail, rapes same woman again after 2 yrs with friend; makes video
55.article_body: A man, who was released on bail in a 2020 rape case, allegedly raped the same woman at knife-point with his friend about a month back in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur, police said. The accused allegedly made a video, police added. The man threatened to make the video viral on social media if the previous complaint wasn't withdrawn, the victim claimed.

56.title: Deepak Deswal loses in men's 100-kg quarterfinals in judo at CWG 2022
56.article_body: Judoka Deepak Deswal, who defeated Cameroon's Eric Jean Sebastien in his round of 16 elimination bout earlier today, has lost to England's Harry Lovell-Hewitt in the men's 100-kg quarterfinals at the CWG 2022. India have won two medals, a silver and a bronze, in judo so far in the ongoing games. Judoka Shushila Devi had won silver in women's 48-kg.

57.title: Bikers snatch Bollywood director's phone in Delhi's Connaught Place
57.article_body: Two bike-borne men reportedly snatched a Bollywood director's mobile phone in the inner circle of Connaught Place in Delhi on Monday. Yogesh Ishwar Dhabuwala told police that the incident took place when he was standing at the edge of the street around 10:20 pm and was about to book a cab. "There's crucial information on my phone," Yogesh told police.

58.title: Principal booked for siphoning ₹11 cr from mid-day meal scheme: Police
58.article_body: A principal of Firozabad's primary school has been booked by Agra Police for allegedly siphoning ₹11.46 crore from the Mid-Day Meal (MDM) scheme. The teacher used fake documents to register a Non-Government Organisation (NGO) and siphoned funds with help of the officials and staff of his department and banks, Agra's Superintendent of Police (Vigilance) said.

59.title: No possibility of aligning with DMK in future: Tamil Nadu BJP chief
59.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai said there is no possibility that the saffron party will align with DMK as there is a stark contrast between their ideologies. "DMK senior leaders still talk about...separate Tamil Nadu. It's against...DNA of BJP," Annamalai added. His comments came after PM Modi inaugurated 44th International Chess Olympiad in presence of CM Stalin in Chennai.

60.title: Ro's Co-founder Rob Schutz to step down, assume advisory role
60.article_body: Rob Schutz, Ro's Co-founder and Chief Growth Officer, will step down from his position and will undertake an advisory role. The decision comes weeks after the digital health company laid off 18% of staff citing expense management and resource mapping. In an email to staff, Schutz said Ro has gotten to a scale where he can confidently pass the baton.

61.title: Defending a title is an even more special feeling: Paddler Sathiyan on CWG gold
61.article_body: Indian paddler Sathiyan Gnanasekaran has said that defending their 2018 CWG games gold in the men's table tennis team event at the ongoing CWG in Birmingham is "an even more special feeling". He added, "I have no words to describe this feeling...We'll now focus on individual events, it's a great start." Indian paddlers defeated Singapore 3-1 in the final.

62.title: Work for 2023 Karnataka polls unitedly: Rahul to state Congress unit
62.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday urged the party’s Karnataka unit to work unitedly for 2023 Assembly polls and not speak out publicly on leadership and internal matters. He attended state unit’s Political Affairs Committee meeting. "Entire leadership of Karnataka will join hands together and win...2023 polls…party leaders should not speak in different voices," Congress' KC Venugopal said.

63.title: Over 300 schools in Pune district have no access to drinking water
63.article_body: At least 333 schools in the Pune district lack access to drinking water facilities, data released by the state water supply and sanitation department showed on Tuesday. Additionally, 641 schools in Pune also don't have running water in toilets. Addressing this, Pune Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad said that the requisite facilities will be provided to these schools by mid-September.

64.title: Seems weird that Asia Cup is Kohli's audition but may well be that: Bhogle
64.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle said it sounds "very weird" that Asia Cup 2022 will be an audition for batter Virat Kohli, but added that it might well be that. "With Kohli, you are not looking at how many runs he has scored," he stated. Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said that Kohli might be seen opening in the Asia Cup.

65.title: Bounty raises $4.7 mn in seed round, aims to get brands onboard
65.article_body: Bounty has secured $4.7 million in seed round led by consumer tech venture capital firm M13. Bounty, an online platform that helps budding TikTok creators make money from their content, said that funding will be used to take brands onboard that are on waitlist. Bounty, that currently has 30 brands onboard, is tapping into brands' growing interest in small creators.

66.title: Haryana Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi resigns, set to join BJP
66.article_body: Congress leader and Haryana MLA from Adampur constituency Kuldeep Bishnoi on Wednesday handed his resignation letter to the state Assembly Speaker. "We need to strengthen work done by CM Manohar Lal Khattar. We should give good message even to BJP that popular leader is joining the party," he said earlier. Bishnoi is set to join BJP on Thursday.

67.title: ED attaches 2 builders' assets worth ₹415 crore in 'India's biggest bank fraud'
67.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth ₹415 crore from builders Sanjay Chhabria and Avinash Bhosale, who were arrested in the Yes Bank-DHFL case that caused an alleged loss of ₹34,000 crore to a consortium of 17 banks. It is being called India's biggest bank fraud. The attached assets included land parcels and flats in Mumbai and high-end luxury cars.

68.title: Kansas voters block effort to ban abortions in state constitution
68.article_body: Voters in US state of Kansas on Tuesday rejected a constitutional amendment that would have declared that there is no right to abortion. Kansas is the first state to hold a referendum on abortion after US Supreme Court overturned Roe vs Wade in June, a ruling that granted abortion rights to women.

69.title: Pic of actress Pranitha sitting at husband's feet for ritual sparks debate, she responds
69.article_body: An image of actress Pranitha Subhash sitting at her husband's feet for a ritual has sparked a debate, with some social media users raising questions about patriarchy. "Just because I'm an actor...doesn't mean...I cannot follow a ritual that I...completely believe in," she responded. "One can be forward thinking and modern, but that doesn't mean one forgets one's roots," said Pranitha.

70.title: Did not take adult scenes from 'Forrest Gump' in 'Laal...': Aamir Khan
70.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has said a few changes have been made to 'Laal Singh Chaddha' from the original film 'Forrest Gump' to "suit the sensibilities of the Indian audiences". "The Hollywood film had a few adult scenes, we did not take those in our film," he added. Aamir said he wanted people to watch the film with their families.

71.title: FSSAI starts nationwide drive to check adulteration in edible oils
71.article_body: To check adulteration in edible oils and the presence of trans-fatty acids in hydrogenated oils, the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has launched a nationwide campaign. The campaign, which will end on August 14, will also crack down on the sale of loose edible oil and multi-source edible oils without proper labelling across the country.

72.title: Got 1st film while asleep, wouldn't get films later even by running: Pankaj
72.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said he got his first film while he was sleeping, adding he wouldn't get movies even by running after that. "Someone told them, 'An actor is sleeping over there, he has decent comic timing'...They...woke me up. I asked them, 'Who're you?'" added Pankaj. "I was like, 'What kind of a man is he?'" he stated.

73.title: Nintendo Switch sales fall 22% to 3.43 million units in Q1
73.article_body: Japan's Nintendo said on Wednesday that it sold 22% fewer Switch consoles in the quarter ended June compared with the corresponding period in the previous fiscal. The gaming company sold 3.43 million units of the console as against 4.45 million in the year-ago period. The company is forecasting a fall in the annual sale of the Switch devices this year.

74.title: Srikanth was so distraught, it was painful to watch him cry: Satwik on losing CWG final
74.article_body:
After India lost mixed badminton team final at CWG 2022, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy said, 
"[Kidambi] Srikanth anna was so distraught...But it's not just his mistake though he's blaming himself. Even I lost a match." He added, "It was painful to watch him cry." Srikanth lost his singles match in the final, while Satwiksairaj and Chirag Shetty lost the men's doubles match.

75.title: I was expecting bronze, had goosebumps while collecting silver medal: Vikas
75.article_body: Indian weightlifter Vikas Thakur, who won the silver medal in the men's 96-kg category at CWG 2022, has said he was expecting a bronze medal as the competition was "tough". He added, "I gave my best and won silver...Had goosebumps (while collecting the medal)...I dedicate the medal to my mother." Indian weightlifters have won eight medals so far.

76.title: No Oppn MP participated in 'Tiranga bike rally': BJP's Amit Malviya
76.article_body: No Opposition MP chose to participate in the 'Tiranga bike rally’ which was flagged off from the Red Fort on Wednesday, BJP leader Amit Malviya said. "Is this an unequivocal admission that BJP is the sole custodian of the Tiranga, a symbol of our national pride?" Malviya tweeted. The 'Tiranga bike rally' was organised today for MPs of all parties.

77.title: Sun Pharma Chairman Israel Makov to retire on August 29
77.article_body: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries on Wednesday said its Chairman Israel Makov will retire from the company on August 29. Makov has led the Mumbai-based pharma major for 10 years. "Makov has played a significant role in the company's global expansion...He guided the company into its next phase of growth with focus on innovation," Sun Pharma MD Dilip Shanghvi said.

78.title: It's all because of you: Chris Pratt on 8 yrs of 'Guardians of...'
78.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Pratt took to Instagram after 'Guardians of the Galaxy' completed eight years of its release. The film had released on August 1, 2014, in the United States. "I'm constantly blown away by the community we've built in the past eight years! And it's all because of YOU," Chris wrote. The film was directed by James Gunn.

79.title: Pune Police arrest 4 for snatching gold chains during Palkhi processions
79.article_body: The crime branch of Pune Police arrested four men on Monday for snatching gold chains and robbing devotees during Palkhi processions in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad. Police also recovered 24 tola gold ornaments worth ₹12,24,000 and two mobile phones worth ₹1,30,000 from the accused. According to police, the accused used to sell the stolen ornaments in Ahmednagar district.

80.title: Chandigarh Police arrests drunk man for brandishing 'weapon' while driving
80.article_body: A 23-year-old inebriated man was arrested by police for allegedly brandishing a "weapon", which was later found to be a dummy gun, while overspeeding near Chandigarh’s Nexus Elante Mall. On receiving information on Monday night, police stopped the man for checking when they found out that the weapon in the car was a dummy. After examination, he was found drunk.

81.title: Sri Lanka to restart IMF bailout talks in Aug: Prez Wickremesinghe
81.article_body: Sri Lanka's new President Ranil Wickremesinghe told Parliament on Wednesday that the country will restart bailout talks with International Monetary Fund (IMF) in August. He also called on lawmakers to form an all-party government to resolve a crippling economic crisis. Wickremesinghe took office last month after his predecessor Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country and quit following mass protests.

82.title: Rupee falls 27 paise to 78.80 against US dollar in early trade
82.article_body: The rupee fell 27 paise to 78.80 against the US dollar in opening trade on Wednesday. The rupee opened at 78.70 against the US dollar at the interbank foreign exchange, then declined to 78.80, registering a fall of 27 paise over the last close of 78.53 on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the dollar index fell by 0.07% to 106.16.

83.title: Traffic to be affected in Mumbai's Western Express Highway, Malabar Hill
83.article_body: Traffic movement is expected to be slow on Western Express Highway and Malabar Hill on Wednesday morning due to scheduled VVIP visit, the Mumbai Police said. "Traffic is likely to be slow between Santacruz Airport, WEH to Malabar Hill from 10:30 am to 11:30 am and Malabar Hill to Regal Circle from 12:30 pm to 06:00 pm," the police tweeted.

84.title: 'The Kashmir...', 'Bhool...' worked: Aamir on claims of B'wood films not working
84.article_body: Aamir Khan reacted to claims that Bollywood films are not doing well. "I don't see a shift. Historically, the films aren't good, people don't like them...People like films that are nice," he stated. Aamir added, "Now, people are liking Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa', Anupam Kher's 'The Kashmir Files' and Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' so it's working. Recently...'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' also worked...well."

85.title: 9-yr-old drowns in pit created by construction work in Gurugram
85.article_body: A nine-year-old boy allegedly drowned to death in Gurugram in a water-filled pit created by construction work on the Dwarka Expressway in Sector 109, police said. The incident took place when the victim went to bathe in the pit with a few friends on Monday evening. His friends got scared and fled from the spot after he drowned, police added.

86.title: Ruchira Kamboj takes charge as India's 1st woman UN envoy, says 'All girls can make it'
86.article_body: Ambassador Ruchira Kamboj on Tuesday took charge as India's first woman envoy to the UN in New York and presented her credentials to UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres. She tweeted, "A privilege to be the first Indian woman to be given the honour to hold this position. To the girls out there, we all can make it!"

87.title: Rahul changes profile pic to Nehru holding Tiranga amid BJP's campaign
87.article_body: Rahul Gandhi has changed his Twitter profile photo to India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru holding national flag, a day after PM Narendra Modi asked Indians to put national flag as profile picture as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "The tricolour is the country's pride. It is in the heart of every citizen," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

88.title: Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine out of control: UN nuclear chief
88.article_body: Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine "is completely out of control", UN nuclear watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) chief Rafael Grossi warned. "Every principle of nuclear safety has been violated" at the Zaporizhzhia plant, which Russian troops seized in March, Grossi said, urging Russia and Ukraine to allow experts to visit the complex to avoid a nuclear accident.

89.title: India under leadership of PM Modi has given us a breath of life: Sri Lanka President
89.article_body: Expressing gratitude towards PM Narendra Modi and people of India, newly elected Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday said, "Government of India under the leadership of PM Modi has given us a breath of life." "I wish to specially mention the assistance provided by India, our closest neighbour, in our efforts for economic revitalisation," Wickremesinghe added.

90.title: Daughter Palak Tiwari is too busy to meet me: Raja Chaudhary
90.article_body: Actor Raja Chaudhary, speaking about his daughter Palak Tiwari, has said that he does not get a chance to meet her. "I message or email her and wait for her reply...Maybe she is too busy or maybe she is ignoring me," he added. Palak is Raja's daughter from his marriage with ex-wife and actress Shweta Tiwari.

91.title: TRS MP Nageswara Rao's son robbed at knifepoint in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
91.article_body: The son of TRS MP N Nageswara Rao was robbed of ₹75,000 at knifepoint in Hyderabad, police said. The incident occurred on July 30 when two men on bike asked Rao's son Prithvi to stop his car and got into the vehicle. They then forced Prithvi to transfer money online, police said, adding that the two were later arrested.

92.title: People said 'shadi kab hui, bachha kab hua', to hell with that kind of thinking: Alia
92.article_body: Speaking on her pregnancy, Alia Bhatt said, "There were a few who said, 'Shadi kab hui, bachha kab hua'." Bhatt said, "Women are always questioned and are constantly battling things as if it's their fault." She added, "I'd like to say to hell with that kind of thinking. We're in 2022 and people should start living like they're in 2022."

93.title: Really pains me when women have to bear being beaten, depression: Alia
93.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said it "really pains" her when women have to bear ridiculous situations like being beaten or feeling depressed. "It pains me to see that...a lot of women still think there is no way out of a bad marriage," added Alia. "For women, like the one I play in 'Darlings', the idea of divorce is impossible," she stated.

94.title: I should be okay by the weekend: Rohit on retiring hurt in 3rd WI T20I
94.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma, who had retired hurt on 11 after suffering a back spasm while chasing WI's 165-run target in the third T20I, has said he should be "okay" by the weekend. Talking about the match, Rohit said, "We used the conditions and our variations really well...[our chase] was quite clinical." The fourth T20I will be played on Saturday.

95.title: 6-km jam on Pune-Bengaluru highway as thousands gather for Siddaramaiah's birthday
95.article_body: Karnataka's Davanagere district witnessed a six-kilometre-long traffic jam on the Pune-Bengaluru highway as thousands of people gathered for the 75th birthday celebrations of former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah. "I would like to appeal to those who come to Davanagere...to drive carefully and not in undue haste," Siddaramaiah tweeted. Notably, one person going to Davanagere died in a road accident.

96.title: Militant group claims responsibility for downing Pak army helicopter
96.article_body: Baloch Raaji Aajoi Sangar (BRAS) on Tuesday claimed responsibility for targeting and downing a military helicopter, which went missing on Monday. All six people on board the helicopter, including a senior commander, were killed. However, the Pakistan army said that the helicopter had crashed on a mountain during a flood relief operation in Balochistan province due to bad weather.

97.title: US sues state of Idaho for near-absolute ban on abortion
97.article_body: The US sued the state of Idaho for imposing a "near-absolute ban" on abortion. According to US Justice Department, the ban would criminalise doctors who provide medical services approved by federal law. Idaho's abortion ban was coming into effect  in the aftermath of US Supreme Court's decision to overturn landmark ruling Roe vs Wade.

98.title: Man forcibly castrated, jailed for 25yrs for raping 8-yr-old stepdaughter in Kazakhstan
98.article_body: A man has been castrated for raping his eight-year-old stepdaughter, with a court in Kazakhstan sentencing him to 25 years in jail. The judge ordered him to undergo 'forcible chemical castration'. The convict, who had been married four times, subjected the girl to three years of abuse starting from when she was five, the court was informed.

99.title: CAA is our commitment, we'll do it: Bengal BJP chief
99.article_body: Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that CAA is core issue for Bengal BJP, the way Ram Mandir was an issue for All India BJP. "CAA is our commitment, we'll do it...People are forced to come because of atrocities committed on Hindus," he added. On Tuesday, Home Minister Amit Shah said that CAA will be implemented after COVID vaccine drive.

100.title: Uber sells 7.8% stake in Zomato for $392 million: Reports
100.article_body: Uber Technologies on Wednesday sold its 7.8% stake in Zomato for $392 million via a block deal on local exchanges, according to reports. The stake was reportedly bought by around 20 global and Indian funds, including Fidelity, Franklin Templeton and ICICI Prudential. The Zomato block deal was executed at ₹50.44 per share, the reports added.

101.title: GST Council a rubber stamp, we opposed hike: TN Finance Minister
101.article_body: Tamil Nadu Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan on Wednesday said that the GST Council is a "rubber stamp". "We sent a written submission that we opposed the hike...We have the most complex GST model among 140 countries with thousands of flaws," Rajan added. "It operates with lack of meetings…It is anything but federalism," he stated.

102.title: Rohit, Dravid have given players more freedom, security: Hardik Pandya
102.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has praised captain Rohit Sharma and head coach Rahul Dravid for making the players feel "secure" in the team. "Players are not looking over their shoulder; [Rohit and Dravid are] making sure [players] are getting ample chances; they're getting told as well if they are not playing and that is something which is commendable," explained Hardik.

103.title: Kerala's Aluva Mahadeva Temple submerges amid heavy rain; red alert in 3 districts
103.article_body: Kochi's Aluva Mahadeva Temple got submerged as the water level in the Periyar river continued to rise amid heavy rains in Kerala. India Meteorological Department issued a 'red' alert for Kottayam, Idukki and Ernakulam and an 'orange' alert for eight other districts. As many as 12 people lost their lives in different rain-related incidents in Kerala since Sunday, officials said.

104.title: Mahua had a flourishing corporate career: Swara Bhasker on TMC MP's '₹1.5 lakh bag'
104.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said that it did not seem like TMC MP Mahua Moitra was trying to hide her branded bag during a debate on inflation in the Parliament. Swara tweeted, "She had a flourishing corporate career and bought branded items with her own hard earned money. Haw! How 'controversial'." Reports claimed the bag was priced over ₹1.5 lakh.

105.title: He's in form of his life, don't tinker: Shastri on Suryakumar opening
105.article_body: Ravi Shastri said batter Suryakumar Yadav should be asked to bat at the number he'll bat in the T20 World Cup 2022, having opened in the T20Is against West Indies. "Let him go in different situations, maybe two wickets down early...Suryakumar's in the form of his life at that middle-order position," he added. "Don't tinker around," he stated.

106.title: Pune airport will be built at original site in Purandar: CM Shinde
106.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde stated that the proposed airport in Pune will be constructed at the earlier site identified in Purandar tehsil by the then Devendra Fadnavis government. Shinde further said land acquisition for the airport will not be done forcefully. "First, we'll acquire...land from those who are ready to give. Simultaneously, we'll start...discussion with other farmers," he added.

107.title: People said, 'What if people laugh on your performance': Sunil on doing different roles
107.article_body: Sunil Grover, in an interview, was asked if his comic characters impacted his chances of getting different roles. To this, he replied, "Maybe I have been lucky that people have accepted my male characters apart from comedy." "It has happened sometimes that people said, 'You have a funny image, what if people laugh on your performance'," he added.

108.title: India risen from slumber, moving towards becoming 'great' power: Amit Shah
108.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday urged people to participate in 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and tell world that India has "risen from slumber". Shah added India is swiftly moving forward and is heading towards becoming a "great" power. He was addressing an event held to celebrate the legacy of freedom fighter Pingali Venkayya, who also designed the Indian flag.

109.title: Author Civic Chandran granted anticipatory bail in sexual assault case
109.article_body: A Kerala court granted anticipatory bail to author Civic Chandran in a sexual assault case, the complaint of which was lodged by a woman writer in July. He had allegedly sexually harassed her during a book exhibition in Kozhikode in April. Another woman filed a sexual harassment case against Chandran for allegedly making sexual advances during an exhibition in 2020.

110.title: Russia declares Ukraine's Azov Regiment as a terrorist group
110.article_body: Russian Supreme Court designated Ukraine's Azov Regiment as a terrorist organisation on Tuesday. At least 1,000 soldiers of Azov Regiment, which was formed in 2014 as a paramilitary group to fight pro-Russian rebels, are held by Russia in eastern Ukraine. Azov called upon Washington to declare Russia a terrorist state, claiming it is looking for new justifications for war crimes.

111.title: What actions has China taken against Taiwan over US House Speaker Pelosi's visit?
111.article_body: After US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, Chinese army announced drills and missile test launches encircling Taiwan. Earlier, Chinese media said the country launched joint navy and air force exercises around Taiwan. China announced suspending imports of citrus fruits, chilled white striped hairtail and frozen horse mackerel and export of natural sand. China also summoned US' ambassador.

112.title: US CHIPS bill offers chance for US-Taiwan cooperation: Pelosi
112.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi told the Taiwanese Parliament on Wednesday that the CHIPS bill would offer a good opportunity to US and Taiwan for cooperation in the chip industry. The bill was passed in US Senate and House of Representatives and will now be signed by US President Joe Biden. Pelosi called for more parliamentary exchange with Taiwan.

113.title: Dinesh Karthik is 'not' a finisher: Ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth
113.article_body: Ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth said Dinesh Karthik cannot be termed as a finisher, adding a finisher is a player who can take the match from the eighth or ninth over and finish it. "What Karthik is doing can be called final touches...Hardik Pandya, Rishabh Pant are finishers...and...Rohit Sharma [who] can...play till...17th over in 12th gear is also [one]," he stated.

114.title: Why is Ashwin in WI T20 series? I’m confused: Kris Srikkanth
114.article_body: Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth has questioned Ravichandran Ashwin's place in India's squad for the ongoing WI T20Is. "Why was [Ashwin] not playing the T20Is in England and then suddenly why is he in the T20Is for the WI? It's confusing...your first spinner is Jadeja...[and second should be] Chahal because he is the wrist spinner," stated Srikkanth.

115.title: Police to issue challans to 2-wheelers entering Delhi-Meerut Expressway
115.article_body: The Ghaziabad Traffic Police is likely to start issuing challans to two and three-wheelers for entering expressway lanes of the Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME), officials said. The DME has three inside lanes on each side designated as expressway lanes where entry of two and three-wheelers are not allowed. The violators will be penalised with ₹20,000 fine, a traffic police official said.

116.title: US Senate passes bill to help veterans exposed to toxic burn pits
116.article_body: US Senate passed a bill that aims to strengthen health care for veterans exposed to burn pits. The bill, passed with 86-11 votes, will allow veterans to receive disability payments to compensate for their illness without having to prove that it was a result of their service. The bill was passed in June but was delayed due to technical error.

117.title: I'm looking for more medals: Sharath after men's table tennis team's gold
117.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal said he's targeting more medals after the gold medal in the men's table tennis team event at CWG 2022. "I'm looking for more medals in singles, doubles and mixed...It's the first time I've defended a title and we've done it very well," added Sharath. "This gold builds a lot of confidence," he stated.

118.title: Oppn wasn't targeted like this even during Emergency: Shiv Sena on Raut's arrest
118.article_body: After Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by the ED, the party on Tuesday said such targeting of Opposition didn't take place even during the Emergency imposed by the then PM Indira Gandhi. "People in power have decided to chop off the tongues or strangle those who speak the truth," the Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

119.title: BMC links Tansa Main with BPT line, several areas to face water cut tomorrow
119.article_body: Several parts of Mumbai, including the Mumbai International Airport, Bandra Terminus and areas across Dharavi will get no water supply on Thursday. The water supply will be hit because the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken work on connecting Tansa Main with BPT (Break Pressure Tunnel) line. The work will be carried out from 10 am till 12 midnight.

120.title: 25-yr-old detainee escapes jail after ripping out toilet in Belgium
120.article_body: A 25-year-old man escaped a detention cell in Belgium after ripping out its toilet, police said on Tuesday. The escapee reportedly "unhooked the toilet from the wall" and slipped out "through a hole no larger than an A4 sheet of paper". From that hole, he allegedly landed into an underground corridor and climbed out of a window onto the street.

121.title: Oil prices fall ahead of OPEC+ supply meeting today
121.article_body: Ahead of the meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC)+ on Wednesday, oil prices slipped with the WTI for September delivery falling below $94 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange in Singapore. Brent for October settlement slipped to $99.71 a barrel on the ICE Futures Europe exchange. US crude stockpiles expanded by over 2 million barrels.

122.title: Power of a vision: Goyal on India being home to 75,000 startups
122.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday said, "India is now home to 75,000 startups in the 75th year of Independence and this is only the beginning.'' He further said, "These numbers tell the power of a vision.'' Goyal had recently said that the country aspires to become the world's largest startup ecosystem.

123.title: High-level inquiry ordered, will see if Andhra gas leak was random or deliberate: Min
123.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Minister of Industries Gudivada Amarnath on Wednesday said that a high-level inquiry has been ordered into the suspected gas leak incident at a company in Anakapalle district. "It remains to be determined whether it was a random or a deliberate act," he added. "The samples have been sent to ICMR for further inquiry," Amarnath further said.

124.title: Trolls can't stop a good film: Milind Soman on 'boycott Laal...' Twitter trend
124.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Milind Soman has reacted to the 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' Twitter trend. "Trolls can't stop a good film," Milind tweeted. Earlier, actor Aamir Khan, who stars in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', reacted to the trend and said, "I feel sad...because many people who are saying this, in their hearts, believe I'm someone who doesn't like India."

125.title: T'gana encourages oil palm cultivation to cut vegetable oil import: Reports
125.article_body: Telangana is encouraging farmers to shift to oil palms as it is targeting two million additional acres for their cultivation over the next four years, a Reuters report said. This could reduce India's vegetable oil import which was $18.9 billion a year ago. India imports nearly 14 million tonnes of vegetable oil annually to meet two-thirds of its demand.

126.title: Taiwan military raises alertness level as China announces live-fire drills
126.article_body: Taiwan's cabinet said the military has increased its alertness level and authorities will make plans to ensure safety and stability around the island. This comes after China announced a series of military exercises, including live-fire drills, encircling Taiwan in response to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. The cabinet added that citizens should feel reassured about their security.

127.title: Govt lists dos and don'ts to avoid contracting monkeypox
127.article_body: The government has listed dos and don'ts to avoid contracting monkeypox. The government asked people to isolate infected patients, wash hands with soap and water and wear masks and gloves near infected patients. The government warned against sharing linen and bedding with infected patients, washing clothes of infected and non-infected persons together and going into public if one has symptoms.

128.title: The film industry can mess with your mental health: Tanishaa Mukerji
128.article_body: Actress Tanishaa Mukerji said it's "very important" to enter the film industry with strong backing and go in front of the camera "with a strong sense of self". "The industry can...mess with your mental health because no matter...how successful you are, people will tell you how you should be," she added. Tanishaa made her Bollywood debut with 'Sssshhh...'.

129.title: Was important to bat deep, we saw what happened in 2nd T20I: Suryakumar
129.article_body: India's Suryakumar Yadav said it was important for someone to bat 15-17 overs after Rohit Sharma retired hurt on 11 after suffering a back spasm while chasing WI's 165-run target. "[In the second T20I]...we saw what happened...it was important for someone to bat deep," stated Suryakumar. Brandon King had helped WI to chase down India's 139-run target in second T20I.

130.title: Rohit breaks Kohli's record for smashing most sixes in T20I cricket as India captain
130.article_body: Rohit Sharma on Tuesday broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing the most number of sixes in T20I cricket as India captain. With his sole six in the third T20I against West Indies, Rohit took his tally of sixes as captain in T20I cricket to 60. Kohli had slammed 59 sixes as captain in T20Is.

131.title: SRK sang the entire song, explained the meaning: Bhardwaj on 'La Ilaaj'
131.article_body: Discussing the song 'La Ilaaj' from Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Darlings', director and the movie's music composer Vishal Bhardwaj said, "Shah Rukh Khan called me one night around 12-12.30 am...[and] sang the entire song." "He said, 'It would have been more fun had the song been for me'...I felt so nice," added Bhardwaj. Bhardwaj stated that SRK even narrated the song's meaning.

132.title: Sub-inspector on patrol duty stabbed in Secunderabad, case registered
132.article_body: A sub-inspector of Hyderabad's Marredpally police station suffered injuries after he was stabbed by a person in Secunderabad. The incident took place late on Tuesday night when Sub-Inspector A Vinay Kumar was on patrol duty. According to reports, Kumar had questioned two suspicious persons in a drunken state following which one of them stabbed him in his abdomen.

133.title: Seema Punia misses medal by 1.07m in women's discus throw at CWG 2022
133.article_body: Indian discus throwers Seema Punia and Navjeet Kaur Dhillon finished fifth and eighth respectively in the women's discus throw final at the CWG 2022 on Tuesday. Punia's best throw of 55.92m in her six attempts was 1.07m short of Nigeria's Obiageri Amaechi's bronze medal-winning throw of 56.99m. Navjeet produced a best throw of 53.51m in the final.

134.title: Maharashtra MLA Uday Samant's car attacked in Pune, 5 arrested
134.article_body: Pune Police arrested five persons in connection with the attack on Maharashtra's Ratnagiri MLA Uday Samant's car on Tuesday. The vehicle of Samant, an MLA from Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction, was attacked by some people with baseball sticks and stones. "CM Shinde's convoy was ahead of me. Police will investigate whether they were following me or CM," Samant said.

135.title: 8-yr-old girl dies in Bengaluru after inhaling pesticide fumes
135.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died after suspected pesticide poisoning on Tuesday at Bengaluru's Vasanth Nagar. The incident occurred after the family returned to their rented house in Bengaluru where painting and pest control was done a few days back. All three members of the family felt breathing difficulties and rushed to hospital. The eight-year-old died while undergoing treatment.

136.title: Which 10 states have the most active COVID-19 cases as India reports 17,135 new cases?
136.article_body: India has reported 17,135 COVID-19 cases and 47 deaths in the last 24 hours including 12 reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,37,057, while the death toll reached 5,26,477. Kerala has the maximum active cases in the country at 13,177, followed by Maharashtra with 12,583 active cases and West Bengal with 12,254 active cases.

137.title: Sharath would cry on the phone: Brother on his hamstring injury in 2015
137.article_body: Following India's gold medal in the men's table tennis team event at CWG 2022, Rajath Kamal, who is the brother of table tennis player Sharath Kamal said Sharath was "quite depressed" after his hamstring injury in 2015. "It was his toughest test. He...had to take complete bed rest...He used to call us and cry on the phone," added Rajath.

138.title: Our people suffered, what was happening in govt was intolerable: Maha CM
138.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said after the MVA government was formed, people used to visit him because "some people" had no time to meet them. "Our people suffered, what was happening in the government was intolerable," CM Shinde added. "Government came to power and our party chief became Chief Minister. We all got down to work," he stated.

139.title: One of the best feelings: Akshay Kumar on reports of being India's highest taxpayer
139.article_body: Akshay Kumar has said that he has been told he is the highest taxpayer in India, adding, "It's one of the best feelings." He said, "I'm really honoured. It feels great that the Income Tax Department recognises the whole thing and gives credit to people. Also, It's good that when you earn, you give back to the country."

140.title: Farmers call off proposed protest after Punjab CM accepts demands
140.article_body: The farmer bodies on Tuesday called off their proposed protest scheduled for Wednesday after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann accepted most of their demands. Sugarcane dues stand at ₹195.60 crore and out of which ₹100 crore will be paid by August 15, CM said. "We have decided to cancel the FIRs registered against farmers for stubble burning and agitation," Mann added.

141.title: Heavy rains cause waterlogging, traffic jams in Bengaluru
141.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Bengaluru on Tuesday, causing waterlogging and traffic jams in several parts of the city. Over 50 vehicles were damaged by water on roads and two-wheelers were stuck in the middle of the road. Several low-lying areas like Sai Layout and Yelachenahalli were inundated. According to the IMD, Bengaluru is likely to receive heavy rainfall on Wednesday.

142.title: VP Naidu flags off 'Tiranga bike rally' for all MPs from Red Fort
142.article_body: Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu on Wednesday morning flagged off the 'Tiranga bike rally' from the Red Fort for the MPs of all parties. The rally will culminate at Vijay Chowk near the Parliament. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Tuesday said that the rally has been organised by the Culture Ministry and not the BJP.

143.title: US House Speaker Pelosi meets Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen
143.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi met Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday. Tsai thanked Pelosi for her support of democratic values and voiced her commitment to working with the US on security in the Taiwan straits and Indo-Pacific region. Tsai also promised economic cooperation with US. Pelosi has become the highest ranking US official to visit Taiwan in 25 years.

144.title: You walked out the moment I said paneer had VAT in Bengal: Sitharaman to TMC MP
144.article_body: After TMC MP Derek O'Brien said that Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman evaded their issues on price rise and GST in Parliament, she tweeted, "You just walked out the moment I said in W. Bengal, pre-GST, paneer had a VAT on it." She added that she replied on every issue raised by the TMC MP including cesses, LPG, GST and rupee.

145.title: Morale went down when SA levelled but didn't lose hope: Saikia on gold
145.article_body: Nayanmoni Saikia, who's a member of India's women's fours lawn bowls team that won the gold medal at CWG 2022, said, "Our morale went a little down when South Africa levelled 1-1 [in the final]." "We didn't lose hope. We talked...and understood...we can do it," she added. Nayanmoni's teammate Rupa Rani Tirkey said they'd never thought of winning the gold.

146.title: Video of Ashneer Grover's lookalike at a 'kirtan' goes viral; he responds
146.article_body: A video of BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover's lookalike at a kirtan in Vrindavan's ISKCON temple went viral on social media. Sharing the video on Twitter, Grover wrote, "Hey doppelgänger! Bhai itne maze se kirtan kar raha hai jitna maza mujhe dhandhe mein aata hai! Super fun!! (He's having as much fun at kirtan as I have in doing business)."

147.title: Have done enough work, don't need poll symbol to get elected: Maha CM
147.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said he has worked a lot in his constituency and doesn't need an election symbol to get elected. He asserted that his government only forged "a natural alliance of Shiv Sena once again". "We took this decision because...in...upcoming elections, Shiv Sena would have had only that many MLAs as...can be counted on fingers," he added.

148.title: Man kills wife in front of 9-year-old daughter in Pune, arrested
148.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his 30-year-old wife with a piece of stone floor tile in front of their nine-year-old daughter in Pune's Wakad area on Monday, police said. The accused, who had fled after committing the crime, has been arrested, police added. "We have learnt that the two were having disputes over domestic issues for some time," police stated.

149.title: Sensex gains 155 points, Nifty above 17,380 in opening trade
149.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in green on Wednesday with the Sensex gaining 155.47 points at 58,291.83, while the Nifty was above 17,380.50 points with 35 points up. Bharti Airtel, Eicher Motors, JSW Steel, Cipla and Power Grid Corp were among the top gainers on Nifty. Stocks of Kotak Mahindra Bank, Coal India, Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors and M&M slipped.

150.title: US' determination to preserve democracy in Taiwan remains iron-clad: Nancy Pelosi
150.article_body: After visiting Taiwan despite China's warnings, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said, "America's determination to preserve democracy here in Taiwan and in the world remains iron-clad." "Taiwan is flourishing democracy....Now, more than ever, America's solidarity with Taiwan is crucial, that's the message we bring in today," Pelosi said after meeting President of Taiwan, Tsai Ing-wen.

151.title: We felt like we had enough: Pooran after defeat in 3rd T20I vs India
151.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation ceremony after their seven-wicket defeat in the third T20I against India, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said they felt they had enough runs on the board to win the game. "Wicket was on the slower side, felt it was difficult to keep scoring on it," he added. India chased down WI's 165-run target to win.

152.title: Cong MP wears garland of vegetables to Parliament to protest against price rise
152.article_body: Congress MP Rajani Patil on Tuesday wore a garland of raw vegetables to Parliament as a sign of protest against inflation and price rise. "Housewives are distraught," Patil said. "We wore these vegetables today to express sympathy for them. Until prices fall, we women won't have a sense of relief but FM isn't ready to listen to us," she stated.

153.title: 'Kesariya' is no. 1 on the charts: Alia on 'love storiyaan' criticism
153.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has reacted to the criticism of the song 'Kesariya' from her upcoming film 'Brahmastra'. "The song is number one on the charts, then why should I complain," she stated. The song received criticism and trolling for the use of the lyrics 'love storiyaan'. The film also features actor Ranbir Kapoor.

154.title: Important to forget defeat, come back stronger for individual games: PV Sindhu
154.article_body: After the Indian shuttlers lost the final in the badminton mixed team event at CWG 2022, two-time Olympic medal-winning shuttler PV Sindhu said they need to forget the defeat and come back stronger in individual events. "A bit sad that [we] missed gold...[but] it's part of the game...it's time to chill...and then prepare for the individual [matches]," she stated.

155.title: Mumbai to witness good rainfall next week: IMD
155.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted good rainfall in Mumbai post weekend (from August 8), along with partly cloudy skies with possibility of light thundershowers in the city and suburbs over the next two days. Districts around Mumbai, including Thane, Raigad, Satara, Pune and Kolhapur, have been given a yellow alert for Friday and Saturday by the meteorological department.

156.title: Number of people hospitalised after gas leak in company in Andhra rises to 87
156.article_body: The number of people who have been hospitalised following the suspected gas leak at a company in the Brandix Special Economic Zone in Andhra Pradesh's Anakapalle has risen to 87. No casualties have been reported yet and all the victims are in stable condition, police said. Those who have been hospitalised complained of nausea, stomach ache, cough and suffocation.

157.title: US sanctions Putin's rumoured girlfriend, freezes her visa
157.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's rumoured girlfriend Alina Kabaeva and other Russian elites. The US' Treasury Department said that the government has frozen Kabaeva's visa and imposed other property restrictions. Alina is an Olympic medal-winning gymnast and also the head of a Russian national media company.

158.title: Is govt worried about Mehul Choksi, Nirav Modi?: Congress’ Adhir
158.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that the party knows BJP’s strategy to anyhow "frame and intimidate" the Opposition. "DHFL caused a loss of ₹34,615 crore. From Mehul Choksi to Nirav Modi, they pocketed thousands of crores. Is the government worried about them?" Chowdhury asked. "Have they tried to get it back?" Chowdhury added.

159.title: China summons US ambassador over Pelosi's 'egregious' trip to Taiwan
159.article_body: China summoned US ambassador Nicholas Burns to protest against US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's "egregious" visit to Taiwan, state media reported. The US "shall pay the price for its own mistakes", Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Xie Feng said. Xie also urged Washington to "immediately address its wrongdoings, take practical measures to undo the adverse effects caused by Pelosi's visit".

160.title: 4 labourers fall to death from 17th floor while fixing crane in Gurugram
160.article_body: At least four labourers died and one was seriously injured after they fell off the 17th floor of a residential society in Gurugram's sector 77 on Tuesday evening. The accident took place when five labourers were dismantling a tower crane at Emaar Palm Heights. One of the labourers fell on the safety equipment on the 12th floor, police said.

161.title: We get together once a week, will always be a family: Aamir on his ex-wives
161.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan opened up about his equation with his ex-wives Reena Dutta and Kiran Rao on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. "I have the highest regard and respect for both of them. We will always be a family," the 'Laal Singh Chaddha' actor said. He further added, "We all get together once a week, no matter how busy we are."

162.title: Amazon leases land from L&T in Mumbai's Powai to set up data centre
162.article_body: Amazon Data Services India leased 5.5 acres of industrial land with a possible growth space of 2.39 lakh sq ft, from Larsen & Toubro, in suburban Mumbai's Powai space for setting up a data centre for ₹3.57 crore per month. The lease for the land is for 21 years and six months, with a lock-in period of 15 years.

163.title: 2 people arrested for faking accident, extorting money in Bengaluru
163.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday arrested two people for allegedly extorting money by faking to be accident victims. The accused had reportedly threatened a car owner by acting as victim after hitting the car with their bikes. They then collected ₹40,000 from the car owner, reports said. According to police, the same bikes had been used in similar offences in past.

164.title: Who are India's medal contenders at CWG 2022 for today?
164.article_body: Weightlifters Lovepreet Singh, Purnima Pandey and Gurdeep Singh will participate in their respective finals at CWG 2022 today. Saurav Ghosal will feature in men's squash bronze medal match. Swimmers Advait Page and Kushagra Rawat's 1500m men's freestyle final will also take place today. Tejaswin Shankar and Manpreet Kaur will feature in men's high jump and women's shot put finals, respectively.

165.title: Who clinched medals for India at CWG 2022 on Day 5?
165.article_body: India clinched four medals on Day 5 of CWG 2022. Lovely Choubey, Rupa Rani Tirkey, Pinki and Nayanmoni Saikia won the women's fours lawn bowls event to clinch India's first-ever CWG gold in lawn bowls. India bagged gold in table tennis men's team event and silver in badminton mixed team event. Weightlifter Vikas Thakur bagged silver in men's 96-kg category.

166.title: There is no GST on withdrawal of cash from banks: FM Sitharaman
166.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said there is no GST on withdrawal of cash from banks. She added that 10 transactions from ATMs are totally free, including five from the parent bank and five from other banks' ATMs. She said GST is imposed on banks as they purchase cheque books from printers and there is no tax on customer cheques.

167.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 2 gold medals on Day 5?
167.article_body: India bagged two gold medals on Day 5, taking their gold medal tally at CWG 2022 to five. India have clinched a total of 13 medals so far. India are placed sixth on the medal standings. With 42 gold medals, Australia lead the standings, followed by England (31), New Zealand (13), Canada (11) and South Africa (6).

168.title: Vikas Thakur pays tribute to Sidhu Moosewala, celebrates his silver with 'thappi'
168.article_body: Weightlifter Vikas Thakur celebrated his CWG 2022 silver in men's 96-kg category by paying tribute to late singer Sidhu Moosewala. After lifting 191 kg in clean and jerk, Vikas did Moosewala's signature 'thappi'. "It was a tribute to Moosewala...I didn't eat for two days after his death...I've never met him but his songs will remain with me forever," Vikas said.

169.title: I failed in Chemistry, can't help my child with that or Physics: Alia
169.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she "failed" in Chemistry and won't be able to help her future child with the subject, despite having a lot of chemistry with her husband Ranbir Kapoor on-screen. Alia added she won't be able to guide her future child with Physics also. "Biology I will still manage," she stated. Alia announced her pregnancy in June 2022.

170.title: Many times actors give money back when films don't do well: Alia Bhatt
170.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said the producers think that a reassessment of actors' fees needs to be done. She added that actors feel the same way too. "Many times, an actor charges a certain fee...when the film doesn't do well, they don't charge the balance fee. They even give the money back. But we don't do PR for that," she stated.

171.title: Bengaluru reports 1,274 new COVID-19 cases, active cases reach 8,296
171.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,274 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the number of active cases in the city to 8,296, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath. No deaths were recorded in the city on Tuesday. The test positivity rate for the last seven days now stands at 7.58%, data showed.

172.title: Video shows tanks rolling on packed beach in China amid tensions over Taiwan
172.article_body: A video showing tanks rolling on a packed beach in China amid tensions over US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan has surfaced online. Social media users shared videos of tanks on highways and reported spotting heavy movement of armoured vehicles near the border with Taiwan, which China claims as its own territory.

173.title: CNG, PNG prices increase by ₹6 and ₹4 respectively in Mumbai; 5th hike in 2022
173.article_body: Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and domestic Piped Natural Gas (PNG) prices have increased in Mumbai, effective from midnight of August 2. CNG will now cost ₹86/kg, after an increase of ₹6 and PNG will cost ₹52.50/Standard Cubic Metre (SCM), after an increase of ₹4. This is the fifth time in 2022 that CNG and PNG prices have increased in Mumbai.

174.title: Liquor vends open in Delhi with limited stocks, 126 give up licence
174.article_body: Liquor vends in national capital reopened on Tuesday with limited stocks as Delhi government extended their permits for a month. Meanwhile, 126 liquor shops located in areas like Greater Kailash, Rohini and Chandni Chowk gave up their licence.
