The new excise policy aimed to open 849 liquor shops in Delhi, but only 468 vends were reportedly operational on July 31.

175.title: Mumbai man poses as woman on Facebook, extorts money; arrested
175.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly extorting money from another man by posing as a woman on Facebook. The accused, Sushant Talshilkar, allegedly claimed to be a resident of the victim's housing society and exchanged obscene pictures, an official said. Talshilkar also demanded ₹10,000 from the victim for not leaking their chats on society's Whatsapp group.

176.title: India record their highest successful T20I run chase in West Indies, take 2-1 series lead
176.article_body: India defeated West Indies by seven wickets in the third T20I to take a 2-1 series lead. India recorded their highest successful T20I run chase on West Indies soil by chasing down a 165-run target. India's previous highest successful T20I chase on West Indies soil had come on August 6, 2019, when they chased down a 147-run target.

177.title: 13-year-old boy runs away from home in anger near Mumbai, rescued
177.article_body: Maharashtra's Panvel Taluka Police reunited a 13-year-old boy with his family after he ran away from his home in Revdanda after getting angry over some issues. He had come to Panvel, near Mumbai, instead of going to school on Monday. Police rescued the boy after finding him standing near a tea stall in school uniform at Panvel ST bus station.

178.title: India win silver in badminton mixed team event, take their medal tally at CWG 2022 to 13
178.article_body: Defending champions India bagged a silver medal in the badminton mixed team event at Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. India lost the final 1-3 against Malaysia. In the final, India lost the men's doubles, men's singles and women's doubles matches. India's only victory in the final came through PV Sindhu's women's singles encounter.

179.title: Can't compromise quality of education with 100% reservation: SC
179.article_body: Striking down the decision of the Jharkhand government reserving 100% teaching posts for locals in government-run tribal district schools, the Supreme Court said quality of education cannot be compromised due to reservation. Tribal teachers filed appeals after they were suddenly out of jobs. The non-tribal teachers called the state government's decision a violation of their fundamental rights.

180.title: Devotees should visit Amarnath shrine before Aug 5: J&K LG
180.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor, Manoj Sinha, told Amarnath devotees to visit the shrine before August 5 due to predictions that weather would turn more inclement later. The yatra is scheduled to end on August 11. In July, a cloudburst struck the holy cave of Amarnath, which resulted in overflowing of the 'Nallah', adjoining the cave.

181.title: Man supplying arms to Khalistanis arrested in Madhya Pradesh
181.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a man for allegedly supplying arms to Khalistanis. The accused, identified as 22-year-old Asan Singh, was arrested in Burhanpur and several country-made pistols were recovered from him. Police said that they had received information that Asan Singh was involved with Khalistanis and had since launched an operation to arrest him.

182.title: New Startup and Innovation Policy soon: MK Stalin
182.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government will unveil a new Startup and Innovation policy, Chief Minister MK Stalin said. "My dream is Tamil Nadu should become the numero uno investment destination in South Asia. Development has been planned to ensure adequate representation of regions and districts in the state," Stalin said. He said he was working towards achieving the $1 trillion economy.

183.title: Centre invites MPs of all parties for Tiranga bike rally on Aug 3
183.article_body: A Tiranga bike rally will be organised from the Red Fort to the Parliament on August 3. Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Pralhad Joshi urged members of all political parties to attend it. After the BJP Parliamentary Party Meeting, he said that the event was being organised by the Culture Ministry and not the BJP.

184.title: Interim govt must focus on inflation and security: Bulgaria Prez
184.article_body: Bulgarian President Rumen Radev on Tuesday urged the country's interim government to ensure spiralling inflation is brought under control and that Sofia stays away from the Russia-Ukraine war. Bulgaria will head to the polls in October after PM Kiril Petkov's government collapsed in June. Apart from inflation and regional conflicts, Bulgaria also faces the uncertainty of natural gas supplies.

185.title: India's Kuruvilla beats Pak's Zafar to enter CWG women's singles plate final
185.article_body: Indian squash player Sunayna Kuruvilla beat Pakistan's Faiza Zafar 3-0 to reach the women's singles plate final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Tuesday. Kuruvilla won the semi-final with a scoreline of 11-2, 11-4, 11-5. The 23-year-old will face Mary Fung-A-Fat, who beat Pakistan's Amna Fayyaz 3-2, on Wednesday. Earlier, Saurav Ghosal lost in men's singles semi-final.

186.title: Two arrested in Assam for alleged links with terror group in B'desh
186.article_body: Two individuals with alleged links to an Al-Qaeda network in Bangladesh have been arrested in Assam's Barpeta district, police said on Tuesday. According to police, one of the suspects was arrested on Sunday and the other one on Tuesday. Earlier on Monday, Assam Police had informed that 11 persons were arrested for suspected links with Bangladesh-based Ansarullah Bangla Team(ABT).

187.title: UN chief to visit Japan on 77th anniversary of atomic bombing
187.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres will attend the 77th anniversary of the world's first atomic bombing at the annual ceremony at Japan's Hiroshima Peace Memorial. "The ceremony aims to console the souls of those lost to...bombing...pray for...lasting world peace," UN spokesman Stephane Dujarric said. The US dropped the atomic bomb on Hiroshima on August 6, 1945, killing 1,40,000 people.

188.title: US Prez Biden picks senior officials to lead response to monkeypox
188.article_body: US President Joe Biden appointed two senior federal officials to coordinate the government's response to monkeypox, said the White House on Tuesday. The officials are from the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Unlike the Biden administration, the states of New York, California and Illinois have declared a state of emergency over the disease.

189.title: Congress living in slavery for Gandhis: Anurag Thakur on protests
189.article_body: Claiming that the Congress party is "still living in slavery" for the Gandhi family, Union Minister Anurag Thakur slammed the party leaders for questioning the investigation against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case. "Does the law not apply to the Congress leaders?" he asked. Following ED summons to Sonia Gandhi, Congress leaders protested across the country.

190.title: Water to get costlier in Gurugram as GMDA announces 5% hike
190.article_body: Water supplied by the Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority will now be costlier, with the authority announcing a 5% hike in the bulk water supply. GMDA officials on Tuesday stated that charges for bulk water supply, for both residential and industrial connections, will now be ₹10.50 per kilolitre as against the earlier tariff of ₹10 per kilolitre.

191.title: German rail operator staff who save energy to get monetary benefits
191.article_body: German rail operator Deutsche Bahn on Tuesday said it is offering its staff monetary benefits to save energy at the workplace. This move comes in as Russian energy giant Gazprom significantly reduced its supplies to Germany ahead of winter. Deutsche Bahn said each employee will be given a bonus of at least Euro 100 ($102) to start the conservation efforts.

192.title: They demonstrated great dexterity: PM after Indian women's lawn bowls team win gold
192.article_body: After India bagged gold in women's fours lawn bowls event at CWG, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Historic win in Birmingham...India is proud of Lovely Choubey, Pinki Singh, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey for bringing home the prestigious gold in lawn bowls." He added, "The team has demonstrated great dexterity and their success will motivate many Indians towards lawn bowls."

193.title: Over 20 Chinese military planes enter Taiwan's airspace after Pelosi's visit
193.article_body: More than 20 Chinese military planes entered Taiwan's airspace shortly after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi landed in Taipei on Tuesday, Taiwan said. Pelosi landed in Taiwan on Tuesday evening, defying a string of warnings and threats from China. China called Pelosi's Taiwan visit "extremely dangerous" and said it will "launch a series of targeted military operations to counter this".

194.title: Actors don't want to work with me, most want younger actresses: Neena
194.article_body: Neena Gupta has said finding male actors opposite her in projects is the "most difficult thing" because no one wants to work with her. "Most of them want...younger actresses...although I might look younger than them," the 63-year-old actress added. Neena further said she wants to thank Ram Kapoor for taking up the role opposite her despite being younger than her.

195.title: Wanted to do Nach Baliye but was told 'you are not a big actor': Kiku
195.article_body: Actor-comedian Kiku Sharda, recalling his early days in the television industry, said he wanted to do reality shows like 'Nach Baliye' and 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. "But nobody called me...I'd be told, 'You're a good actor but not a big actor...You're not...celebrity'," he added. Kiku said he got a call from Nach Baliye's team after he started doing Kapil Sharma's show.

196.title: Cong workers chant 'ED, haye haye' outside Herald House after raids
196.article_body: Congress workers staged a protest outside the Herald House on Tuesday after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted raids at 12 locations in Delhi in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. A video showed protesters chanting, "ED, haye haye (shame shame)." Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi have been questioned by the ED in connection with the case.

197.title: CCTVs were turned off during IELTS exam: Police on alleged racket in Gujarat
197.article_body: An investigation into an alleged IELTS racket in Gujarat, to get ineligible students admitted to foreign universities, revealed a lack of transparency by the exam agency. Police said that hall CCTVs were turned off during the exam in September 2021. The matter came to light after Indian youths with top IELTS scores failed to speak English in a US court.

198.title: Indian adaptation of Israeli show 'The Hood' in the works
198.article_body: An Indian adaptation of Israeli teen drama series 'The Hood' is in works. The show, titled 'Shchuna' in Israel, follows the children of a small slum located in the heart of a wealthy settlement and explores the differences between the poor and the rich. Israeli-based media company Ananey Studios has signed a deal with Abundantia Entertainment to develop the adaptation.

199.title: Lebanese prosecutor clears ship accused of carrying Ukrainian grain
199.article_body: The Syrian ship that Kyiv had claimed was carrying Ukrainian grain stolen by Russia was cleared to leave Tripoli port by Lebanon's prosecutor general, officials cited by AP said on Tuesday. This reportedly comes after investigation showed that the ship was not carrying stolen goods. However, the ship cannot leave the country till the expiration of a Lebanese court order.

200.title: CM Shinde busy in felicitations instead of providing aid to farmers: Pawar
200.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar alleged that Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde is "busy accepting felicitations" over providing aid to farmers. "Soyabean and cotton farmers have suffered huge losses due to floods in Vidarbha and Marathwada region," Pawar said. He added, "No word has been sent to the Centre and, as a result, no team from there has visited yet for inspection."

201.title: 2 suspected patients test negative for monkeypox in Rajasthan
201.article_body: The test results of two suspected cases of monkeypox in Rajasthan came back negative, Dr Ajit Singh, Superintendent of Rajasthan University of Health Sciences said on Tuesday. A 20-year-old youth from Kishangarh and a man from Bharatpur were referred to the institute after showing symptoms similar to those of monkeypox.

202.title: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl smashes 34 runs in an over against Bangladesh in T20I, hits 5 sixes
202.article_body: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl today smashed 34 runs in an over in the third T20I against Bangladesh. The 28-year-old smashed five sixes and one four in the over bowled by Nasum Ahmed. Only Yuvraj Singh and Kieron Pollard (36 each) have scored more runs in an over than Burl in T20I cricket. Zimbabwe defeated Bangladesh by 10 runs in the match.

203.title: ED probing crypto exchange WazirX for money laundering of ₹2,790 cr: Govt
203.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary has said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) is probing WazirX for allegedly laundering ₹2,790 crore. He added that investigation done so far has revealed that WazirX was using walled infrastructure of Cayman Islands-based Binance. It has also been found that all transactions between the two exchanges weren't even being recorded on blockchains, he said.

204.title: After laying off 624 employees in May, Vedantu lays off another 100: Reports
204.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Vedantu has laid off another 100 employees in a restructuring exercise, reports said. According to reports, permanent employees from sales and training teams were laid off over the last month. In May, the company had laid off 624 employees, including permanent employees and contractual educators, accounting for over 10% of its workforce.

205.title: Delhi reports 1,506 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 10.63%
205.article_body: Delhi reported 1,506 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, while the positivity rate in the national capital decreased to 10.63%. Delhi also reported three deaths in the last 24 hours. The positivity rate in the city was at 11.41% on Monday, the highest in the last six months. Delhi reported 822 COVID-19 cases on Monday.

206.title: IFS officer Shweta Singh appointed as Director in PMO
206.article_body: Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer Shweta Singh was appointed as a Director in Prime Minister's Office (PMO), a Personnel Ministry order said on Tuesday. The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) approved Singh's appointment for a period of three years. The ACC has cancelled the appointment of Aniket Govind Mandavgane as the Deputy Secretary in the PMO.

207.title: 2 more held in K'taka BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru's murder case
207.article_body: Karnataka Police on Tuesday arrested two more persons, 32-year-old Saddam and 42-year-old Harris, in connection with the BJP Yuva Morcha worker Praveen Nettaru's murder case. Two others, Zakir and Shafiq, were arrested in connection with the case on 28 July. Praveen Nettaru was hacked to death by two bike-borne miscreants on July 26 in Bellare in Dakshina Kannada district.

208.title: Sri Lanka looks for friendly settlement of Chinese ship issue: PM
208.article_body: Sri Lanka is looking forward to settling the issue of a Chinese research vessel's visit to the country with an "approach of friendship", Sri Lankan PM Dinesh Gunawardena said on Tuesday. "Both countries are our close friends," he added. The vessel is "coming to refuel and not for any other purpose", a Sri Lankan Cabinet spokesman said

209.title: US Ambassador to Japan warns of China's economic coercion
209.article_body: US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel on Tuesday said his country is working with like-minded nations like Japan to counter Chinese efforts of using economic power to make political changes around the world. Emanuel laid out several examples of China's coercion, including with Japan, South Korea and Australia. He said he is pushing what he calls "commercial diplomacy".

210.title: Salman Khan spotted in ₹1.5 crore bulletproof car, pic surfaces
210.article_body: Actor Salman Khan, who has reportedly upgraded to a Toyota Land Cruiser with bulletproof glass, was spotted arriving in the car at the Mumbai airport on Monday evening. As per various reports, the new vehicle costs around ₹1.5 crore. The actor has upgraded to the new armoured car amid threats to his life, reports said.

211.title: India raises concerns over Chinese 'spy' ship's visit to Lanka next week: Reports
211.article_body: India has raised concerns over the upcoming visit of a Chinese surveillance ship to Sri Lanka next week, reports said on Tuesday. The matter of Yuan Wang 5's docking was raised by India at the highest level in Colombo, reports said, following which Sri Lanka said it will only stop to refuel. India earlier said it was monitoring the visit.

212.title: Banks in India reported 248 data breaches in last 4 years: Govt
212.article_body: Banks in India reported 248 successful data breaches by hackers and miscreants between June 2018 and March 2022, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said. Most of these data breaches pertain to card detail leakage and theft of business and non-business information, Karad said. Public sector banks reported 41 data breaches while private sector banks reported 205 data attacks.

213.title: If we were traitors, would people support us?: Maha CM Shinde
213.article_body: Responding to Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray's "traitor" remark, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said if he and his supporters had been traitors, they would not have received support from the state's people. NCP and Congress, who were supposed to be out of power after 2019, received a "sanjivani butee" because of their alliance with the Sena, he said.

214.title: Centre aims to transform the country, make it corruption-free: Gadkari
214.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the aim of the central government is to transform the country and make it corruption-free. Addressing an 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' event organised by the Republican Party of India (RPI) in Delhi, he said the Centre will eliminate poverty and aims to bring socio-economic parity between people.

215.title: MP man gets life in jail for burning wife for cutting garlic without permission
215.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh has been sentenced to life imprisonment for burning his wife to death. In 2018, the accused, Prakash Bheela, had beaten up his wife and burnt her by pouring kerosene on her after she cut garlic without informing him. The court issued an order for an arrest warrant against Bheela, who is currently out on bail.

216.title: 9 killed, 76 hurt as oil tanker explodes in Libya
216.article_body: Around nine people were killed and 76 others injured when a fuel tanker caught fire and exploded in central Libya, officials said. It overturned in Bent Bayya and scores of people started collecting leaked gasoline when the truck exploded. The injured were taken to nearby medical centres and 16 critical persons were sent to the capital of Tripoli and Benghazi.

217.title: Indian squash player Ghosal crashes out in men's singles semis at CWG 2022
217.article_body: Indian squash player Saurav Ghosal crashed out in the men's singles semi-final at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 in Birmingham. Paul Coll of New Zealand beat Ghosal 3-0 on Tuesday. The 35-year-old lost with a scoreline of 9-11, 4-11, 1-11. Ghosal will now play in the bronze medal match on Wednesday.

218.title: 9 TV channels taken off air between 2017-2022 for code violation: Thakur
218.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur informed that nine TV channels were taken off air for a specified period between 2017-2022 for code violations. Replying to a Lok Sabha question, Thakur also informed that the ministry has issued directions to block 94 YouTube-based news channels during 2021-22. He added, "CBFC has...refused certification to 11 songs [during 2017-2022]."

219.title: Tax on devotion: Punjab CM on 12% GST on inns near Golden Temple
219.article_body: Punjab CM condemned the Centre's decision to impose a 12% GST on inns near Golden Temple. He said the tax has been imposed on pilgrims' devotion. Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee also criticised the Centre's decision, arguing that inns for pilgrims aren't commercial properties. In June, GST Council decided to impose a 12% GST on hotel rooms priced up to ₹1,000/day.

220.title: Nearly 25% of undertrial prisoners in India were in UP as of 2020: Govt
220.article_body: The Union Home Ministry on Tuesday said that as of 2020, nearly 25% of the country's 3,71,848 undertrial prisoners were in Uttar Pradesh. With 80,557 undertrial prisoners, Uttar Pradesh accounted for the highest number of undertrial prisoners, followed by Bihar with 44,187 undertrial prisoners. Arunachal Pradesh had the lowest number of undertrial prisoners at 127.

221.title: 50 hospitalised after suspected gas leak at company in Andhra
221.article_body: Over 50 women working at a company in the Brandix Special Economic Zone in Andhra Pradesh's Anakapalle district fell sick following suspected gas leakage. The employees, who complained of nausea, stomach ache, cough and suffocation, were admitted to the government hospital at Anakapalle and a few other hospitals. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

222.title: Brad Pitt's pictures in skirt on the red carpet go viral
222.article_body: Brad Pitt recently arrived at the Berlin premiere of his upcoming film 'Bullet Train' in a skirt. He wore a knee-length skirt and boots, paired with a loose-fit linen shirt and jacket. Speaking with Variety and addressing the choice of his outfit, the actor said, "I don't know! We're all going to die, so let's mess it up."

223.title: Stellar show: Anurag Thakur on Indian men's table tennis team's CWG 2022 gold
223.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter following defending champions India's gold medal win in men's table tennis team event at Commonwealth Games 2022 on Tuesday and wrote, "A stellar show by the Indian men's table tennis team." He added, "Exhilarated by the way, our paddlers led by Sharath Kamal, Sathiyan Gnanasekaran and Harmeet Desai outclassed the formidable Singapore 3-1."

224.title: Followers of Iraqi cleric asked to vacate Parliament amid protest
224.article_body: Followers of Iraqi cleric Muqtada al-Sadr who stormed the Parliament and occupied it as part of a protest have been asked to vacate the building. The protesters were told to move the protest outside the premises of the Parliament. The protest had started last week against the formation of a new government by Sadr's political rivals.

225.title: Reports of Chinese fighter jets crossing Taiwan Strait false: Taiwan
225.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday that Chinese state media reports on China's Su-35 fighter jets crossing the Taiwan Strait, which separates the island from China, are false. The ministry added that it would appropriately dispatch forces in reaction to "enemy threats". This comes amid US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan despite Beijing's warnings of consequences over it.

226.title: Maldives has special place in India's 'Neighbourhood First' policy: PM
226.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday that the Maldives occupies a special place in India's 'Neighbourhood First' policy. His remarks come amid Maldivian President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's visit to India, which is Solih's third visit since assuming office in November 2018. Notably, India will extend an additional credit line of $100 million to the island nation, PM Modi confirmed today.

227.title: Juice shop worker arrested in IIT Madras sexual assault case
227.article_body: The Chennai city police on Tuesday arrested a 24-year-old man in connection with the alleged sexual assault case, which took place inside the campus of IIT Madras in Tamil Nadu last week. A female student was sexually assaulted on July 24 at midnight, when she was returning to her hostel on a cycle.

228.title: Will urge Centre for early wind up of India-Myanmar border fencing: Manipur CM
228.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh said that the state will urge the Centre for early completion of India-Myanmar border fencing work after resolving the border dispute. Responding to queries raised by Congress MLA K Ranjit Singh in the Assembly, CM Biren said that the border fencing of 5.6 km from border pillar number 79 to 81 has been presently completed.

229.title: Not in favour of bars being allowed to open till 3 am: Delhi Police
229.article_body: The Delhi Police has told the High Court that it was not in favour of bars and restaurants serving liquor till 3 am. The Delhi Police and Excise Department were asked to constitute a consultative group to examine the issue. The police in its report said that women's safety was a big concern.

230.title: 2,171 people infected with monkeypox in France: Health Minister
230.article_body: France's Health Minister François Braun on Tuesday told the Parliament that a total of 2,171 people have been infected with monkeypox in the country. France was one of the first countries to start offering free vaccination against the disease, he added. Braun further said that 42,000 doses have been delivered so far.

231.title: 2 hospitals in K'taka designated for monkeypox treatment: Minister
231.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said that two hospitals in the state have been designated for the treatment of monkeypox. "We're taking all precautionary measures to make sure that monkeypox cases do not come to Karnataka," K Sudhakar said. "We've issued guidelines regarding international travellers at airports and ports," the Health Minister added.

232.title: 11 thrash Kanwariyas over playing music on speakers in UP, arrested
232.article_body: Around 11 people have been arrested for allegedly thrashing some Kanwariyas over playing music on speakers in UP's Wazirganj area, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place in Dungarpur village on Monday evening when the Kanwariyas were returning from Bareilly, police added. The accused have been arrested under relevant sections of the IPC, said SP OP Singh.

233.title: ED has become 'weapon of mass destruction' after SC judgement: Cong MP
233.article_body: Criticising the Enforcement Directorate (ED) over raids at National Herald house, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said ED was weaponised earlier, but after the Supreme Court judgement, it has become a "weapon of mass destruction". "It's ridiculous that they (ED) raid the premises of a publication whose transactions are anyway captured in the books of accounts," he said.

234.title: Shinde-led Maha govt sets record by issuing 749 resolutions in a month
234.article_body: The newly formed Maharashtra government led by CM Eknath Shinde and Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has set a new record by issuing 749 government resolutions in a month. These government decisions are purely administrative in nature, related to filling up of deputation posts, provisional seniority list, etc. On an average, 25 government resolutions were issued daily.

235.title: India reported 330 deaths while cleaning septic tanks in 5 yrs: Govt
235.article_body: The central government on Tuesday said 330 people died due to the cleaning of sewer and septic tanks from 2017-2021. However, Union Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale added that there have been no deaths due to manual scavenging in the country. Uttar Pradesh reported the highest number of deaths at 47 from 2017 to 2021.

236.title: MMA fighter Blake Perry's face disfigured after opponent breaks his nose, pic surfaces
236.article_body: US' 27-year-old MMA fighter Blake Perry's face was disfigured after having his nose shattered during his defeat to Marcel McCain in A1 Combat 4 MMA tournament. The incident happened in first round when McCain hit Perry's face with a knee. Blake wanted to continue the fight but wasn't allowed. "I'm healing up quick," Blake wrote on Instagram sharing videos.

237.title: Pics of rare 'ring galaxy' taken by world's most powerful telescope released
237.article_body: The pictures of a rare 'ring galaxy' called Cartwheel Galaxy taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, have been released by NASA. NASA tweeted, "Believe it or not...this galaxy was probably your average spiral galaxy before it collided with a smaller galaxy over 400 million years ago. Now, it's made up of 2 rings."

238.title: Giant 650-foot-deep sinkhole opens up in Chile, picture emerges
238.article_body: Chilean authorities on Monday said they are investigating a giant 'mysterious' sinkhole which opened up near the capital city Santiago. The sinkhole is about 25 meters (82 feet) in diameter and is approximately 200 metres (656 feet) deep, an official said. "We haven't detected any material down there, but we've seen the presence of a lot of water," he added.

239.title: India's trade deficit hits record high of $31 billion in July
239.article_body: India's merchandise trade deficit jumped to a new record high of $31.02 billion in July, Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said on Tuesday. The previous record high was set in June 2022, when trade deficit was $26.18 billion. As per provisional data released by the Commerce Ministry, merchandise imports stood at $66.26 billion while exports stood at $35.24 billion in July.

240.title: 115 arrested for illegal mining in Rajasthan
240.article_body: In a drive against illegal mining, Rajasthan Police arrested 115 people and impounded 278 vehicles from July 22 to 31, an official said on Tuesday. Additional Director General of Police Hawa Singh Ghumaria said 12,616 tonnes of illegally mined stone, gravel and sand were seized. In total, 191 cases have been registered across the state.

241.title: Will launch military action to counter this: China as Pelosi lands in Taiwan
241.article_body: China on Tuesday called US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit "extremely dangerous" and said it will "launch a series of targeted military operations to counter this". Chinese military spokesperson said that the forces have been put on "high alert". This came after Pelosi landed in Taipei and expressed "solidarity" with Taiwan, despite repeated warnings from China.

242.title: 38-year-old drunk man trying to swim across Chambal river drowns
242.article_body: A 38-year-old man drowned on Monday while trying to cross the Chambal river. He was not able to swim due to his drunken state, a report said. The man has been identified as Chagganlal Prajapat, a resident of Hatnara village, Madhya Pradesh. Prajapat was reportedly accompanying Alot's newly-elected sarpanch who had visited Goddess Joganiya temple for the purpose of blessings.

243.title: Al-Zawahiri's death shows we can root out terror without war: Obama
243.article_body: Reacting to Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri's death by US drone strike in Afghanistan, ex-US President Barack Obama said that the incident highlighted that it's possible to root out terrorism without being at war. "I hope it provides a small measure of peace to...9/11 families," he added. Zawahiri became Al-Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

244.title: Uber likely to sell its 7.8% stake in Zomato tomorrow: Report
244.article_body: Uber is likely to sell a 7.8% stake in food delivery firm Zomato through a $373 million block deal on Wednesday, Reuters reported. The offer size of 612 million shares is based on the lower end of a ₹48-54 price range set for the deal. Thus, the deal would be concluded at a 2.8%-13.6% discount to the share's latest close.

245.title: Indian women's hockey team lose to England 1-3 in group match at CWG 2022
245.article_body: Indian women's hockey team lost to England 1-3 in their third Pool A match at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Tuesday. Vandana Katariya scored India's only goal in the fourth quarter. India are currently placed third in the group, with six points from three matches. India will face Canada in their fourth match on Wednesday.

246.title: People should focus on bigger issues: Payal on Ranveer's nude pics controversy
246.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi, while reacting to the controversy surrounding Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot, said that people have made a big issue of his photoshoot which was unnecessary. She added that people should focus on bigger issues like rapes and murders. "It's really sad that they are talking about the photos and neglecting the main issues," Payal further said.

247.title: Somalia appoints former deputy leader of al-Shabaab as govt minister
247.article_body: Somalia's Prime Minister Hamza Abdi Barre on Tuesday named Mukhtar Robow, former deputy leader of al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab terrorist group, as the Minister for Religious Affairs. Robow had split from the group in 2013 and publicly denounced the group when he came to the government side in 2017. Al-Shabaab fighters have killed tens of thousands of people in Somalia.

248.title: Learned Hindi just to understand Amitabh Bachchan's dialogues: Sudeep
248.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep has said that he was a huge fan of Amitabh Bachchan in his youth, adding that he learned Hindi just to understand his dialogues and Kishore Kumar's songs. "It wouldn't be wrong to say that people in the South have learned Hindi largely because of Kishore Kumar's songs and Amit ji's (Amitabh Bachchan) films," he added.

249.title: Congratulations for doing the unprecedented: Prez Murmu on lawn bowls CWG gold
249.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu congratulated Indian women's fours team of Lovely Choubey, Rupa Rani Tirkey, Pinki and Nayanmoni Saikia following their gold medal win in lawn bowls at CWG 2022. "Your resolve in the see-saw battle for victory in the finals made the country proud and inspired every Indian," she tweeted. It is India's first-ever gold in lawn bowls at CWG.

250.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against West Indies
250.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against West Indies in the third T20I. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Deepak Hooda replacing Ravindra Jadeja. Rohit said at the toss that Jadeja is being rested for the match. Both the teams have won one match each in the five-match series.

251.title: BSF troops fire at flying object along International Border in J&K
251.article_body: BSF troops on Monday opened fire at a flying object with a blinking light along the International Border (IB) in J&K's Kanachak sector, an official informed. The unidentified object was spotted while trying to intrude into the Indian territory from across the border, he said. The blinking light was not observed after the object was fired upon, he added.

252.title: US solidarity with Taiwan more important than ever today: Pelosi on reaching Taipei
252.article_body: After reaching Taiwan's Taipei amid heightened tensions with China, US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the visit "honours America's unwavering commitment to supporting Taiwan's vibrant democracy". She said, "America's solidarity with the 23 million people of Taiwan is more important today than ever." World is facing a "choice between autocracy and democracy", she added.

253.title: AAP announces 1st list of 10 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
253.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday released its first list of 10 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party said the candidates include members of tribal, backward and scheduled caste communities. Gujarat AAP Vice Presidents Bhemabhai Chaudhary, Jagmal Vala, Arjun Rathva and Sagar Rabari have been nominated from Deodar, Somnath, Chhotaudepur and Becharaji seats respectively.

254.title: Venus loses in 1st round at Citi Open in her 1st singles match after a year
254.article_body: Former world number one tennis player, Venus Williams, made a first-round exit at the WTA 250 Citi Open in Washington, DC. Notably, this was Williams' first singles match since August 2021. "Just a little rusty... I wish I could have pulled this match through for the crowd... But [it] doesn't always work out," the 42-year-old player said.

255.title: Rename nilgai as 'Jangli Ghoda': LS member urges Govt
255.article_body: A Samajwadi Party member on Tuesday urged the government in Lok Sabha to rename nilgai as 'Jangli Ghoda' (wild horse). Hindu sentiment is attached to monkeys, who are destroying sugarcane crops in parts of western UP, said ST Hasan. There should be an order to capture wild pigs and nilgai for saving crops, he added.

256.title: 22-year-old man booked for alleged rape of classmate in Jaipur
256.article_body: A 22-year-old man in Jaipur has been booked under IPC Section 376 after a complaint accusing him of rape was lodged by his classmate, police informed. The 20-year-old complainant was allegedly raped by the accused who gave her an intoxicating drink in the city's Jagatpura area, police added. The incident took place on Monday evening, police said citing the complaint.

257.title: Vikas Thakur lifts 346 kg to bag silver, India's 8th weightlifting medal at CWG 2022
257.article_body: Indian weightlifter Vikas Thakur bagged a silver medal in the men's 96-kg final at CWG 2022 after lifting a total of 346 kg. The 28-year-old lifted 155 kg in snatch and 191 kg in clean and jerk. India have now won as many as eight medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022, including three gold, three silver and two bronze medals.

258.title: US is directly involved in the conflict in Ukraine: Russia
258.article_body: The US is directly involved in the conflict in Ukraine because American spies have been approving and coordinating Ukrainian missile strikes on Russian forces, Russia said on Tuesday. The US has provided military aid to Ukraine. Russia's invasion of Ukraine has triggered the most serious crisis in relations between Russia and the West since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.

259.title: Chinese fighter jets cross Taiwan Strait amid Nancy Pelosi's visit: Reports
259.article_body: Chinese fighter jets have crossed the Taiwan Strait, local media reported on Tuesday, amid tensions over US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "China's Su-35 fighter jets are crossing the Taiwan Straits," reported state media. China had warned that US will "bear the responsibility and pay the price" if Pelosi visits Taiwan.

260.title: Russian Supreme Court labels Ukraine's Azov Regiment 'terror' group
260.article_body: Amid ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, Russian Supreme Court on Tuesday designated Ukraine's Azov Regiment as a terrorist group. This paves the way for captured soldiers to be tried under anti-terror laws and be jailed for up to 20 years. The Azov Regiment, which began as a paramilitary unit to combat pro-Russian rebels in 2014, was later integrated into Ukrainian national guard.

261.title: Student dies, 36 ill post drinking contaminated water in Chhattisgarh
261.article_body: A 19-year-old student died, while 36 others fell ill in the past three days, after allegedly consuming contaminated water at a nursing college in Chhattisgarh's Durg district, officials said on Tuesday. "The water purifier and coolers were not functioning properly and the students were drinking water from them," a senior official said.

262.title: UP govt dismisses 841 lawyers appointed in Allahabad High Court
262.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh has issued termination notices for 841 government lawyers appointed in the Allahabad High Court with immediate effect. The order was issued by Nikunj Mittal, Special Secretary, Law and Justice Department. Additional Advocate General Vinod Kant was also dismissed and the government letter provided no reason for the termination.

263.title: 75-year-old priest found dead on temple premises in Rajasthan
263.article_body: A 75-year-old priest was found dead on the premises of a temple in Rajasthan's Dholpur district, police said on Tuesday. Harinath Giri was found hanging from a tree, said Superintendent of Police, Dholpur, Dharmendra Singh. Giri, who stayed on the temple premises in Chandpur village, belonged to Uttar Pradesh, he said.

264.title: Census 2021, related activities postponed due to COVID-19: Centre
264.article_body: Union Minister Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said Census 2021 and related field activities have been postponed indefinitely due to the outbreak of COVID-19 in March 2020. The minister added that there were no plans to add the census to the concurrent list, enabling states to conduct it. The concurrent list comprises subjects of the Union and the states' interests.

265.title: India win men's TT team gold medal for 2nd straight time at CWG
265.article_body: India defeated Singapore 3-1 to clinch gold in the men's table tennis team event at CWG 2022. This is India's second consecutive gold medal in men's table tennis team event at CWG. With this, India joined England to bag second-most table tennis gold medals (seven) at CWG. India have now won 12 medals at CWG 2022, including five gold medals.

266.title: A historic gold: Anurag Thakur on India's 1st-ever gold in lawn bowls at CWG
266.article_body: Following India's first-ever gold medal in lawn bowls at Commonwealth Games on Tuesday, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "A historic gold for India." He added, "Absolutely ecstatic that our women's fours team - Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey has fetched the nation its first ever lawn bowls medal defeating South Africa 17-10 in the final!"

267.title: PM announces ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh for pilgrims electrocuted in WB accident
267.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of 10 pilgrims who died after a pickup van got electrocuted in West Bengal's Cooch Behar. He announced ₹50,000 compensation for those injured. The accident may have taken place due to a fault in the wiring of the generator of the DJ system in the van.

268.title: Kartik is the biggest star that we've today in the industry: Masaba
268.article_body: Actress-fashion designer Masaba Gupta has said that actor Kartik Aaryan is the "biggest star that we have today in the industry". Kartik recently made a cameo appearance in her web show 'Masaba Masaba season 2'. "Kartik was so nice and very spontaneous. He was great; it was great energy to have on set," Masaba further said.

269.title: UP govt sanctions ₹797 cr for roadworks near Ram temple in Ayodhya
269.article_body: During a state Cabinet meeting, the Uttar Pradesh government sanctioned ₹797.69 crore for broadening and renovating the roads leading to the Ram temple in Ayodhya. UP Tourism Minister Jaiveer Singh said the 12.940 km road from Saadatganj to Nayaghat on lines of Kashi Vishwanath Corridor, and the road from Faizabad to the Hanuman Garhi and Ram temples will be broadened.

270.title: Chennai's 2nd airport to cost ₹20,000 cr, handle 10 cr people: TN CM
270.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Tuesday that Chennai's second airport at Parandur will cost ₹20,000 crore and have the capacity to handle around 10 crore passengers annually. He added that the airport will be equipped with requisite facilities including two runways, terminal buildings and taxiways. He cited need for a new airport due to surge in passenger traffic.

271.title: Would've been happier if it hit him: Woman who threw shoe at Partha
271.article_body: A woman hurled a shoe at former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, who is an accused in the West Bengal School Service Commission scam, while he was being taken to the ED office on Tuesday. "I would have been happier if the shoe would have hit him on his head," she said when asked why she committed the act.

272.title: US House Speaker Pelosi lands in Taiwan despite Chinese warnings
272.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi reached Taiwan's Taipei on Tuesday, even as repeated warnings by China against the visit raised tensions between US and China. The top US official was reported to have been travelling in an Air Force aircraft which took off from Malaysia's Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday, although there was no official confirmation of the same.

273.title: Gyanvapi case lawyer Abhay Yadav passes away due to heart attack
273.article_body: Senior advocate Abhay Nath Yadav, who was representing the Anjuman Intezamia Masjid (AIM) committee in the Gyanvapi mosque case, died due to a heart attack on Sunday late night. Yadav was rushed to Trimurti Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, where doctors declared him dead upon arrival.

274.title: Vijay meets Salman, Chiranjeevi; says 'Your love for Liger means the world'
274.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda on Monday shared a post on Instagram thanking actors Chiranjeevi and Salman Khan for showering their blessings and love on his upcoming film 'Liger'. He also shared a picture wherein he could be seen standing next to Salman and Chiranjeevi. "Your blessings and love for #Liger mean the world to us! My respect and love always," Vijay wrote.

275.title: Our govt doing 'good work', cabinet expansion soon: Maha CM Shinde
275.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said that his government is doing "good work" and assured that a cabinet expansion will take place soon. Speaking in Pune, Shinde said, "We have reduced VAT on petrol [and] diesel, provided relief to the farmers by resuming the scheme providing an assistance of ₹50,000, reduced power tariff for lift irrigation and others."

276.title: Traffic suspended on J&K's Mughal Road after landslide
276.article_body: Vehicular movement was suspended on J&K's Mughal Road on Tuesday after heavy rains and a landslide was reported in the Poonch district. Several hundred vehicles were stranded on the historic road as clearance operations were underway. The Mughal Road, which connects Poonch and Rajouri districts in Jammu with southern Kashmir, is an alternative to the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway.

277.title: 2 minor girls killed after house collapses in K'taka's Dakshina Kannada
277.article_body: Two minor girls were killed after their house collapsed on Monday following a landslide in the Parvathamukhi village in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district. "The bodies of two minor girls were recovered by National Disaster Mitigation Fund (NDMF) and State Disaster Mitigation Fund (SDMF) personnel," SP Rishikesh Sonawane said. Landslides in the district in early July had claimed three lives.

278.title: Corbevax recommended as booster for adults vaccinated with Covishield, Covaxin: Reports
278.article_body: A government panel has reportedly recommended allowing Corbevax as a precaution dose for adults fully vaccinated with either Covishield or Covaxin. Corbevax, which is India's first indigenously developed RBD protein subunit vaccine, is currently being used to vaccinate children between 12 and 14 years of age. At present, the booster dose is same as the one used for primary vaccination.

279.title: Preparations underway for manufacturing monkeypox vaccine: Poonawalla
279.article_body: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla on Tuesday said all preparations are underway for manufacturing a monkeypox vaccine. "I briefed [Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya] on this. We're researching on the monkeypox vaccine and if there's a need for it," Poonawalla added. Currently, the only licensed monkeypox vaccine is the one manufactured for smallpox by a Danish firm.

280.title: Uber turns its cash flow positive for the first time in Apr-Jun quarter
280.article_body: Uber has recorded positive quarterly cash flow for the first time ever in the April-June 2022 quarter, generating free cash flow of $382 million as trips exceeded pre-pandemic levels. The number of drivers and delivery agents on its platform also rose to an all-time high of almost five million. Uber's net loss in the quarter stood at $2.6 billion.

281.title: Child infected with Ebola-like Marburg virus passes away in Ghana
281.article_body: A World Health Organization (WHO) official on Tuesday said that a child who contracted the highly infectious Ebola-like Marburg virus in Ghana has died. The death brings the total number of fatalities in Ghana to three since the country registered its first ever outbreak of Marburg in July. Notably, three cases of Marburg have been detected in Ghana so far.

282.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's PTI received illegal foreign funds: Poll body
282.article_body: The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) unanimously said on Tuesday that ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) received illegal funding from 34 foreign individuals and businesses. The ECP in its verdict said that the party "willfully" received prohibited funding from countries including UAE, US, Canada and Australia. ECP launched a probe into PTI's funding sources in 2014.

283.title: I-T dept finds over ₹1,000 cr black income of Gujarat-based group
283.article_body: The Central Board of Direct Taxes on Tuesday said it found "unaccounted" income of over ₹1,000 crore in raids conducted on a Gujarat-based business conglomerate last month. Without naming the group, the CBDT said it has businesses in chemicals, textiles, real estate, packaging and education. The raids were conducted in Ahmedabad, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Kolkata.

284.title: Indian swimmers Page, Rawat enter men's 1500m freestyle final at CWG 2022
284.article_body: Indian swimmers Advait Page and Kushagra Rawat qualified for the men's 1500 metres freestyle final after finishing fourth in their respective heats at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham on Tuesday. Page clocked 15:39.25 in the heat one, while Rawat had a timing of 15:47.77 in the heat two. The final will be held on Wednesday.

285.title: Govt acting upon political hatred & revenge: Congress on ED raids
285.article_body: The Congress party on Tuesday criticised the Centre over the Enforcement Directorate (ED) raids in around 14 locations in connection with the National Herald case. "This is the first time in independent India that the government is acting upon political hatred and revenge," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said. This is absolute rock bottom for Indian politics, she added.

286.title: Bill to make rail university autonomous introduced in Parliament
286.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan introduced the Central Universities (Amendment) Bill in Lok Sabha, which seeks to designate the National Rail and Transportation University as an autonomous central university. The bill intends to expand the university's scope to encompass the entire transport sector. "The proposed University will...go a long way in making the nation self-reliant," he said.

287.title: Govt polishing king's image as India battles unemployment: Rahul
287.article_body: India is battling an "epidemic of unemployment", but the government is spending billions just to polish the image of an "arrogant king", Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said on Tuesday. "We have to fight with every decree of the dictator, every attempt to suppress the voice of the people," Rahul said. Don't consider yourself alone, Congress is your voice, Gandhi added.

288.title: EV startup River raises $11 mn in Series A funding round
288.article_body: Electric vehicle startup River has raised $11 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Chris Sacca's Lowercarbon Capital, and saw participation from Toyota Ventures. The company, founded in 2020 by Aravind and Vipin George, plans to launch its first product by 2022 end or early 2023. The product is entirely built and designed in India.

289.title: World's most-tracked plane right now is US jet that may be carrying Pelosi to Taiwan
289.article_body: The most-tracked aircraft in the world right now is a US Air Force jet that took off from Kuala Lumpur, as internet users seek to track US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on a possible trip to Taiwan. Almost 3,00,000 users are following every move of SPAR19, according to FlightRadar24. There is no official confirmation that Pelosi is on the plane.

290.title: ICC invited to make case for cricket's inclusion in 2028 Olympics: Reports
290.article_body: Cricket's apex body, ICC, has been invited to make a presentation advocating the inclusion of cricket in the 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles. Cricket will reportedly be competing for an Olympic spot with eight other disciplines, including lacrosse and baseball. "We are assisting the LA28 organisers and providing them with the information for their assessment," ICC chief Geoff Allardice said.

291.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad acquires test-prep platform Exampur
291.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has acquired test-preparation platform for government jobs Exampur for an undisclosed amount. This is upGrad's third acquisition in a month after acquiring Harappa Education for ₹300 crore and recruitment firm Wolves India for an undisclosed amount. Exampur has a user base of over 10 million students and offers over 200 test-prep courses for government jobs.

292.title: 63-yr-old man, his son die of electrocution in UP's Ghazipur
292.article_body: Police on Tuesday said a father-son duo died after they were electrocuted in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur district. The incident took place on Monday, when 63-year-old Satish Narayan Malviya, a farmer, was bringing down clothes from a wire when his son, 28-year-old Ankit Malviya rushed to help him, police said. They were declared dead when taken to a community health centre.

293.title: B2B SaaS startup WebEngage raises $20 mn in Series B funding round
293.article_body: WebEngage, a B2B software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup, has raised $20 million in its Series B funding round. The round, led by Singularity Growth Opportunities Fund and SWC Global, saw participation from existing investors India Quotient, Blume Ventures and IAN Fund, among others. The firm claims to have burned $6 million to reach an annual revenue run rate of $20 million.

294.title: US dentist found guilty of wife's murder during Zambia trip in 2016
294.article_body: A dentist in the US on Monday was found guilty of shooting his wife to death during the couple's trip to Zambia in 2016. Lawrence Rudolph will be handed over his sentence in February. The convict faces a maximum term of life in prison or the death penalty. Lawrence was also found guilty of cashing in his wife's insurance claims.

295.title: Kohli should play more to return to form instead of breaks: Manjrekar
295.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said that batter Virat Kohli shouldn't be rested but instead be played more in order to return to form. "My personal view is the more Kohli would've played...[it] would've been better for him and Bhuvneshwar Kumar clearly has said...[that] the best way to come out of the rut is by playing," Manjrekar said.

296.title: Mentally unstable youth seen scavenging garbage in Thane; rescued
296.article_body: A 23-year-old mentally disabled youth, who was seen scavenging garbage, was rescued and admitted to a mental health facility in Thane. The facility's dietitian said his condition is now at least 50% more stable than the day he was admitted. A photojournalist, who had worked with several newspapers in Mumbai, was the first to spot the man last week.

297.title: 3 pvt Delhi hospitals to reserve 10 beds each for monkeypox cases
297.article_body: The Delhi government has identified three private hospitals for isolating persons with suspected and confirmed monkeypox cases. MD City Hospital, Batra Hospital and Kailash Deepak Hospital will reserve five beds each for confirmed and five beds each for suspected cases. Delhi reported its third monkeypox case on Tuesday after a 31-year-old Nigerian tested positive.

298.title: Mizoram logs 337 new COVID-19 cases, highest since March 13
298.article_body: Mizoram on Tuesday reported 337 new COVID-19 cases, the highest spike in its daily caseload since March 13, an official informed. On Monday, the state had logged 62 cases of the infection. Mizoram's single-day positivity rate reached 26.98% on Tuesday from 19.25% on the previous day, news agency PTI reported. The state's active case count now stands at 1,197.

299.title: Decentraland announces world's first metaverse ATM
299.article_body: Decentraland has partnered with Transak payment gateway and Metaverse Architects to launch the world's first metaverse ATM. Through the ATM, users can purchase any cryptocurrency. "Just like an ATM in real life, we wanted to give users a more seamless journey while navigating Web3," the ATM's developers said. Details on how ATMs will operate will be available on August 3.

300.title: Repaired cracks on Shikohpur flyover on Delhi-Jaipur highway: NHAI
300.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) on Monday said it has repaired cracks that had appeared in a one foot by one-and-a-half feet area on the flyover at Shikohpur crossing on the Delhi-Jaipur highway. "The repaired area has been barricaded to strengthen it. We'll ascertain the reasons behind this damage and act accordingly," said NHAI Project Director Ajay Arya.

301.title: Protests in B'luru can be held only inside Freedom Park: K'taka HC
301.article_body: Protests in Bengaluru can only be held inside Freedom Park, the Karnataka High Court has directed the state government, adding that strict measures must be taken against those who organise protests anywhere else. A division bench was disposing of a suo motu PIL from last year, after the Mekedatu rally of Congress caused major traffic disruption through the city.

302.title: US will 'pay the price' if Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan, warns China
302.article_body: China has warned US that it will "pay the price" if House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan. "What I can tell you is, the US will definitely have to...pay the price for harming China's sovereignty and security interests," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Hua Chunying told a press briefing in Beijing. Pelosi is expected to visit Taiwan today, as per reports.

303.title: 4 Indians with high IELTS scores fail to speak English in US court, probe ordered
303.article_body: A probe was launched in Gujarat's Mehsana to unearth an alleged illegal racket of helping ineligible college aspirants get high International English Language Testing System (IELTS) scores. This comes as four youths from Gujarat, who were arrested near the US-Canada border, were unable to speak in English in a US court. They had scored 6.5 to 7 bands in IELTS.

304.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
304.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states for the next few days. Extremely heavy rainfall is very likely over parts of Kerala and Tamil Nadu until August 4. It is likely over parts of Karnataka until August 5. Goa and Odisha may witness very heavy rainfall in the upcoming days.

305.title: 'India Out' campaign in Maldives was based on false propaganda: MEA
305.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Tuesday said the 'India Out' campaign in Maldives was based on "misinformation and false propaganda", adding that it didn't reflect the views of Maldivians. The remarks come amid Maldivian President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's current visit to India. The campaign, which started in 2020, accused India of trying to build military presence in Maldives.

306.title: Indian sprinter Dutee Chand fails to qualify for 100m semis at CWG 2022
306.article_body: Indian sprinter Dutee Chand failed to qualify for the women's 100 metres semi-final at Commonwealth Games 2022 on Tuesday. She finished fourth after clocking 11.55 seconds in her heat. Michelle-Lee Ahye of Trinidad and Tobago won the heat in 11.14 seconds. The top three from each heat and the next three fastest qualifed for the semi-final.

307.title: Arshdeep's ability to bear pressure stands out the most: India bowling coach
307.article_body: Team India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey praised Arshdeep Singh, saying he has been watching the India pacer since IPL and his ability to bear pressure stands out the most. "He bowls the hard overs, two in...powerplay and then at...death," he added. Mhambrey further said Arshdeep showed this ability when he bowled the 17th over of second T20I against West Indies.

308.title: China bans several Taiwanese food imports ahead of Pelosi's trip
308.article_body: Ahead of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's proposed visit to Taiwan, China on Monday banned imports from several Taiwanese food brands. "I learned about the ban before I got off work," a business manager at one of the affected Taiwanese food producers told Reuters. China has warned the US of consequences if Pelosi visits Taiwan, which China lays claim to.

309.title: India win gold medal in lawn bowls for the first time in Commonwealth Games history
309.article_body: India on Tuesday won their first-ever gold medal in lawn bowls in the history of Commonwealth Games (CWG). India's Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey defeated the South African team 17-10 in the final of women's fours event to clinch the gold medal. India have now bagged four gold medals at CWG 2022 so far.

310.title: Former New Zealand cricketer Heath Davis comes out as gay
310.article_body: Ex-New Zealand pacer Heath Davis has come out as gay. The 50-year-old opened up about his sexuality in a new documentary series. He stated he started to discover himself during New Zealand's tour to England in 1994. He added he used to go to saunas and seedy places to get sex as he didn't want to be seen.

311.title: Really liked Raksha Bandhan's trailer, it's a film about a common man: Aamir
311.article_body: Aamir Khan has opened up about the box office clash between his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Raksha Bandhan'. "I hope both...do well," he said. Aamir further said he really liked the trailer of 'Raksha Bandhan', adding, "Here is a film that's relevant. It's a film of a common man who does have problems of economic issues."

312.title: Liquor sales in Gurugram up 33% as shops in Delhi remain shut: Officials
312.article_body: Sale of Indian Made Foreign Liquor and Imported Foreign Liquor has risen 33% in Gurugram as several liquor stores are shut or running without adequate stocks in Delhi, senior Excise Department officials said. Liquor demand has increased in last two days and shopkeepers have enhanced their orders across labels, officials added. Several liquor vends also stopped offering discounts from Monday.

313.title: Dark & shady things happened with me in 'Anupamaa': Paras Kalnawat
313.article_body: Paras Kalnawat, who was ousted from 'Anupamaa' for signing 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', in an interview said "dark and shady things" happened with him on the show. "My scenes were cut...I was put in...bad light; people started falsely gossiping about me that I'd threatened them...And if...senior is going to talk against you, makers are going to believe...senior only," Paras added.

314.title: Pune woman cheated of ₹1.67 lakh while trying to order ₹400 cake online
314.article_body: A woman in Pune was duped of ₹1.67 lakh while trying to place an order for a birthday cake worth ₹400 online. A fraudster posed as a bakery employee and tricked her into paying the huge amount. The victim had found the number of the shop after browsing the internet and placed the order there.

315.title: Man hiding $20,000 using papad packets, spice boxes caught at IGI Airport
315.article_body: A Bangkok-bound Indian man was apprehended at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport with $19,900 (₹15.5 lakh) on Tuesday. The man had concealed the foreign currency inside boxes marked as spices and between layers of papad packets, an officer said. He was intercepted during security checks. He could not furnish a valid authorisation for carrying the money, the officer added.

316.title: 4,800 held in 3 yrs for hurting religious feelings, promoting enmity: Govt
316.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs informed the Lok Sabha that 4,794 people were arrested in three years (2018, 2019 and 2020) for hurting religious sentiments and promoting enmity between groups on grounds of religion, race and place of birth. Uttar Pradesh saw the highest number of arrests (628) in such cases, followed by Tamil Nadu and Kerala, minister Nityanand Rai said.

317.title: 6 Pakistani soldiers killed in helicopter crash in Balochistan
317.article_body: Six Pakistani soldiers, including XII Corps Commander Sarfraz Ali, were killed after a helicopter carrying them crashed in Balochistan province, the military said on Tuesday. "Accident occurred due to bad weather as per initial investigations," the military added. The helicopter, which was helping with flood relief work, had lost contact with air traffic control on Monday.

318.title: 6 killed, including 2 girls aged 6 and 11, in landslides in Karnataka
318.article_body: Six persons were killed in Karnataka's Uttara Kannada and Dakshina Kannada districts due to landslides inflicted by heavy rains. In Uttara Kannada, four of a family were killed after a part of a hill collapsed on their house. Meanwhile, in Dakshina Kannada, the bodies of two sisters, Shruthi (11) and Jnanashree (6), were found holding their hands together, police said.

319.title: Suvendu Adhikari briefs Amit Shah on West Bengal SSC scam
319.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari met Home Minister Amit Shah in the Parliament today. He briefed him about the teachers recruitment scam and other issues. "I briefed him how Bengal is completely mired in corrupt activities such as the teachers recruitment scam. Also requested him to implement CAA at the earliest," Adhikari tweeted after the meet.

320.title: I-T Department raids premises of Tamil film producer Anbu Chezhiyan
320.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting raids at 40 locations linked to Tamil film producer GN Anbu Chezhiyan for alleged tax evasion. According to reports, raids started this morning at 6 am on 30 properties, including his home in Madurai and 10 locations in Chennai. He has been under the IT radar since February 2020, reports added.

321.title: Taking action against dubious digital loan apps: Sitharaman to RS
321.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed Rajya Sabha that the Centre is taking action against dubious digital loan apps. "Only a couple of months ago...in Telangana, a lot of people have been put to harassment and action has been initiated," Sitharaman said. She added that the government is also taking action against Indians who assist in establishing these companies.

322.title: Priyanka Chopra 'lost' her Miss World gown during travel, says the actress
322.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra revealed in a new interview that her strapless bejewelled gown that she wore when she was crowned Miss World 2000, was lost "in her many travels". The actress told People magazine that 'she wished she had kept' the gown. "I was always a nomad. I moved around so much, especially in the last 15 years," she added.

323.title: Mumbai woman missing for 20 years found in Pak using social media
323.article_body: A 70-year-old woman from Mumbai, who went missing 20 years ago after emigrating for work, has been traced to Pakistan with the help of social media. As per reports, the woman recently connected with her family in Kurla after moving out of Mumbai in 2002, when she was allegedly cheated by an agent with the promise of employment in Dubai.

324.title: Sambit Patra criticises Opposition for backing Sanjay Raut
324.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Opposition leaders for supporting Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in an alleged land scam case. “Entire India is seeing the manner in which the Opposition is doing politics over corruption," said Patra. The Shiv Sena MP has been sent to ED custody till August 4.

325.title: Edtech startup OckyPocky raises funds from Silicon Valley-based ventures
325.article_body: OckyPocky, an interactive English learning application, has secured an undisclosed amount in seed funding from Silicon Valley-based Goodwater Capital and AngelList Quant Fund, company's founder Amit Agrawal said. The startup, founded in 2017, aims to use funds to grow content for a wider vernacular audience. Udaan Co-founder Sujeet Kumar and SucSEED Indovation Fund are also among its investors.

326.title: Hyderabad receives heavy rains; roads waterlogged & traffic affected
326.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Hyderabad on Tuesday, causing waterlogging and affecting traffic. The traffic movement was disrupted in areas like Khairatabad, Punjagutta, Banjara Hills, Jubilee Hills, Secunderabad, Mehdipatnam, Ameerpet and LB Nagar. The traffic police asked the people to not immediately start their journey after the stoppage of rain and wait for one to two hours.

327.title: New traffic sign spotted on Bengaluru road, traffic police explain its meaning
327.article_body: A man spotted an unusual road sign in Bengaluru and shared a picture on Twitter requesting traffic police to explain its usage. Whitefield traffic police responded, "That is a cautionary sign board which tells about a possible blind person likely on the road. Exercise caution while driving. There is a blind school at Hopefarm junction where this board is placed."

328.title: Monkeypox not a new disease, no need to fear it: Mandaviya
328.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that monkeypox is not a new disease and asserted that India was taking a step-by-step approach to deal with it. "Before the first case in Kerala, we had issued guidelines to all the states," he said. There's no need to fear the virus, Mandaviya added.

329.title: Hardik Pandya is two players in one and is a luxury: McGrath
329.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya, Glenn McGrath said the India all-rounder is two players in one and is a luxury to have. "Hardik is very much a confident player. If he's bowling well, it has a positive impact on his batting...he is a good, intelligent bowler and powerful hitter," he added. Hardik is currently playing in five-match T20I series against West Indies.

330.title: Guj youths with high IELTS score fail to speak in English in US court
330.article_body: A probe was launched in Gujarat's Mehsana district to unearth an illegal racket of helping ineligible college aspirants acquire high International English Language Testing System (IELTS) scores. This comes as four youths from Gujarat, who were arrested near the US-Canada border, were unable to converse in English in a US court. They had scored 6.5 to 7 bands in IELTS.

331.title: Pic shows giant hybrid fish caught by fisherman in US, people comment 'What a monster'
331.article_body: A US fisherman recently caught an enormous tiger muskie in Connecticut's Lake Lillinonah. Taking to Facebook, the Connecticut Fish and Wildlife shared its image and wrote, "The tiger muskie is a cross between a northern pike and a muskellunge." Reacting to it, a person wrote, "I don't want to swim anywhere anymore," while another comment read, "What a monster!"

332.title: Wimbledon winner Elena loses in 1st round in San Jose; blames packed schedule
332.article_body: Wimbledon 2022 women's singles champion Elena Rybakina made a first-round exit from the Silicon Valley Classic in San Jose on Monday. This was the 23-year-old tennis player's first match after winning the Wimbledon final. "It was a tough week after Wimbledon... I had a lot of travelling. I didn't have enough time to prepare for the hard season," Rybakina said.

333.title: Over 10 mn people crossed border from Ukraine since war began: UN
333.article_body: More than 10 million people have crossed the border from Ukraine since the war began, the UN Refugee Agency said on Tuesday. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. As per the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry, the country's forces have killed about 41,170 Russian soldiers and destroyed 1,768 Russian tanks and more than 410 aircraft, including 191 helicopters, so far.

334.title: 32-year-old woman attacked over ₹200 at Kalyan station, 2 arrested
334.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was injured after she was allegedly attacked with a sharp blade by two men at Kalyan railway station after she refused to give them ₹200. The accused were identified as Khwaja Shaikh and Rahim Shaikh, both 30 years old. "The CCTV had captured the entire incident based on which we arrested the two," a police official said.

335.title: Incorrect: Jackky on report saying Akshay & Tiger reduce fees for 'Bade...'
335.article_body: Producer Jackky Bhagnani has reacted to a report claiming that Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff have reduced their acting fees for 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan', following the failure of their last films at the box office. The report also claimed that the film was put on hold due to budgeting issues. Reacting to claims, Jackky tweeted, "Absolutely Incorrect!!"

336.title: Guj woman's hands transplanted in TN man, he promises her mother to take care of tattoos
336.article_body: The hands of a 26-year-old brain dead woman from Ahmedabad were successfully transplanted in a 24-year-old man from Tamil Nadu who lost both his hands due to electrical burns in 2018. The man said the woman's mother broke down seeing the tattoos on her daughter's hands and he promised to take care of them for the rest of his life.

337.title: I'm not convinced it'll last: Lopez's 1st husband on her marriage with Affleck
337.article_body: Ojani Noa, first husband of Jennifer Lopez, spoke about her fourth marriage with Ben Affleck and said he's not convinced that their marriage will last. According to him, Lopez will be married "seven or eight times". "I can't see her...settling down with one person...She pushes herself to constantly go forward in...professional life...but she also moves on in...private life," Ojani added.

338.title: CAA to be implemented after COVID vaccine drive: Shah to Bengal BJP
338.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday assured the West Bengal unit of the BJP that the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) will be implemented once the precaution vaccine dose drive for COVID-19 is completed. Shah said this to West Bengal Leader of Opposition and BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari when the latter said that the situation in the state was 'critical'.

339.title: Man jumps from 1st floor of court building to escape police, injured
339.article_body: An undertrial, Raju Kumar, sustained injuries after he jumped from the first floor of a court building in Gurugram on Monday in a bid to escape police custody, officials said. Kumar is being treated at the civil hospital for his injuries. A fresh FIR has been registered against him for trying to flee, the officials added.

340.title: Advocate dragged out of car, stabbed to death in T'gana's Mulugu
340.article_body: An advocate, Malla Reddy, was waylaid, dragged out of his car and stabbed to death on Monday evening in Telangana's Mulugu district. Malla Reddy's driver told the police that the assailants were wearing clinical masks and dragged the lawyer to the bushes by the roadside. "We...know that there are 10 cases, mostly land disputes, registered against Reddy," police said.

341.title: 15 suspected patients test negative for Monkeypox in Maharashtra
341.article_body: At least 15 samples of suspected monkeypox infection have tested negative for the disease in Maharashtra, a senior health official said on Monday. "So far, not a single positive case has been found in the state," Dr Pradeep Awate, the state's surveillance officer, said. The samples were sent to the National Institute of Virology (NIV) in Pune.

342.title: Baha'i individuals arrested for links with Israel, says Iran
342.article_body: Iran on Monday said it had arrested multiple followers of the banned Baha'i faith for links to a centre in Israel, state media reported. The individuals have also been accused of proselytising, reports said. Notably, the Baha'i International Community, whose governing council operates from Israel, had informed about the arrests of "a significant number of Baha'is" in Iran.

343.title: 2 dead, 4 critically ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
343.article_body: At least two persons died and four others fell critically ill after they allegedly consumed suspected spurious liquor in Bihar's Saran, as per reports. The victims had reportedly gone for a liquor party after finishing their work on Monday evening. "When my husband returned at night, he started vomiting," the wife of one of the victims said.

344.title: PM's brother stages dharna in Delhi with fair price shop dealers' demands
344.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's brother Prahlad Modi on Tuesday staged a dharna in Delhi with various demands raised by the All India Fair Price Shop Dealers' Federation. Prahlad Modi, who is the vice president of the organisation, was joined by other members. Among other demands, they are demanding that the 'West Bengal Ration Model' of free distribution be implemented across India.

345.title: WB Ministers don't pick calls even if we ring 10 times: Minister
345.article_body: Union Minister Pratima Bhoumik, while replying to queries on the implementation of a Central government scheme in West Bengal, said that Ministers in the state don't pick up calls even when called 10 times. Bhoumik said that she has been trying to distribute appliances worth ₹12 crore to differentially-abled and senior citizens in the district but has been unsuccessful.

346.title: Avendus Future Leaders Fund buys stake for ₹195 cr in Xpressbees
346.article_body: Avendus Future Leaders Fund has bought a minority stake in logistics firm Xpressbees for ₹195 crore from Elevation Capital, the company said in a statement. This is the sixth investment from  Avendus Future Leaders Fund II that has assets under management of as much as ₹1,500 crore. In February, Xpressbees raised $300 million in a funding round.

347.title: 3 held for cheating people in Gurugram: Police
347.article_body: Three members of a gang that cheated people by assuring them home delivery of liquor were arrested, Gurugram Police said on Monday. The accused also cheated people on pretext of buying and selling vehicles online, a police official said. "It has been found that they have cheated people to the tune of ₹25 lakh in...last 15 days," the official added.

348.title: Who is 'Most Wanted' terrorist al-Adel, likely to be al-Qaeda's next chief?
348.article_body: FBI 'Most Wanted Terrorist' Saif al-Adel is likely to be the next chief of al-Qaeda after Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a US drone strike, the Middle East Institute reported. He's a former Egyptian Army officer and is wanted in the 1998 US embassy bombings which led to 250 deaths. The explosive expert was earlier affiliated with Egyptian Islamic Jihad.

349.title: Russia warns US over Pelosi's 'purely provocative' visit to Taiwan
