349.article_body: Russia on Tuesday warned the US that an expected visit by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taiwan would put the US on a collision course with China. Pelosi's possible visit is "purely provocative", Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov added. China has said its military won't "sit idly by" if Pelosi visits Taiwan, which Beijing considers its own territory.

350.title: I-T Dept reduces time for ITR verification to 30 days from 120 days
350.article_body: The Income Tax Department has reduced the time limit for e-verification or hard copy submission of the ITR-V. From August 1 onwards, the time limit for e-verification or submission of ITR-V will be 30 days instead of the earlier 120 days. E-verification of an ITR completes the return filing process, failing which, an ITR is treated as invalid.

351.title: Full schedule for Asia Cup cricket 2022 released, India to face Pakistan on August 28
351.article_body: The entire schedule for Asia Cup 2022 has been released. India and Pakistan have been placed in the same group. India will kick off their campaign with a match against Pakistan on August 28 in Dubai. Meanwhile, Sri Lanka will face Afghanistan in the tournament opener on August 27 in Dubai. The final will be held on September 11.

352.title: They have got a 'few challenges': Glenn McGrath on the future of ODIs
352.article_body: Former Australian pacer Glenn McGrath said he believes that ODI cricket will remain exciting as long as runs are being scored, adding that it will be interesting to see the future of ODIs. "They have got a few challenges," he stated. Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram had recently said that ODI cricket is dying and administrators should consider scrapping the format.

353.title: 6 Indian startups selected for South Korean accelerator programme
353.article_body: The K-Startup Grand Challenge 2022 is the world's largest accelerator programme for which six Indian startups have been selected. An initiative of the South Korean Ministry of SMEs and Startups and the National IT Industry Promotion Agency, the programme received over 2,600 applications from 122 countries. Through this initiative, the selected startups can expand their business into South Korea.

354.title: Was offered ₹25 cr to vote for one candidate in Rajya Sabha poll: Rajasthan minister
354.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Rajendra Gudha has alleged that he was offered ₹25 crore if he voted for a particular person in the recently held Rajya Sabha election. He said he asked his wife who told him that they would rather have goodwill. "When the political crisis [in Rajasthan] was going on, I had an offer of ₹60 crore," he added.

355.title: Shraddha to star opposite Kartik Aaryan in 'Tezaab' remake: Report
355.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor has reportedly been approached to star opposite Kartik Aaryan in the remake of 1988 film 'Tezaab'. "Shraddha and Kartik haven't shared onscreen space together so far and if things work out, this is a pair [makers] would like to bet on," India Today quoted a source as saying. The original film starred Madhuri Dixit and Anil Kapoor.

356.title: Pitch was playing nicely, we didn't apply ourselves: Rohit on 2nd T20I loss
356.article_body: After India's five-wicket loss against West Indies in second T20I, India skipper Rohit Sharma said his side didn't bat well in Basseterre. "The pitch was playing nicely but we didn't apply ourselves. But this can happen. When you're doing something as a batting group, you might not always succeed," he added. India were bowled out for 138 in 19.4 overs.

357.title: J'khand schools not notified as Urdu schools told to remove 'Urdu' from name
357.article_body: Jharkhand government's primary education department has issued an order asking schools which have not been notified as Urdu schools to remove 'Urdu' word from their names. The order stated that such un-notified schools should also have a weekly off on Sunday. Moreover, the order also said that morning prayers in these un-notified schools will be kept like in the past.

358.title: Tabu cried thinking I am 'really dead': JD on his death scene in Satya
358.article_body: Discussing a scene depicting his character's death in 'Satya', actor JD Chakravarthy said he was asked not to show the film to his mother as the scene is very real and no mother can see her son dying. JD added that director Ram Gopal Varma told him actress Tabu started crying after watching the film, thinking he was "really dead".

359.title: E-commerce platform Combonation raises $2 mn in pre-seed funding
359.article_body: E-commerce platform Combonation secured a pre-seed funding of $2 million in the latest funding round from undisclosed private investors. The company aims to use funds to expand in technology and manpower. Combonation is looking to open over 50 offline retail stores across Delhi-NCR and has established a plan to expand to more than 100 locations in North India.

360.title: BMC to start door-to-door screening for cancer & diabetes in Mumbai
360.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to start door-to-door screening and hospital examinations for cancer and diabetes from August 15. "Although we are starting with hypertension, the goal is to test Mumbaikars for...diabetes, common malignancies and mental health issues," a BMC officer said. "The scaling up of the programme will take time," she added.

361.title: Private entities can use drones for delivery purposes: Govt
361.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha that government would have no objection if private players use drones for delivery purposes. The response mentioned that the government used drones to deliver vaccines to remote regions during the pandemic. More than 100 Industrial Training Institutes will be opened to teach five courses in drone technology.

362.title: 4 BJP MLAs suspended from Jharkhand Assembly for 'unruly' behaviour
362.article_body: Jharkhand Assembly Speaker Rabindra Nath Mahato on Tuesday suspended four BJP MLAs from the House till August 4. Bhanu Pratap Shahi, Dhullu Mahto, Jai Prakash Bhai Patel and Randhir Singh were suspended for alleged unruly behaviour. This came after a commotion was created in the House as BJP members sought CM Hemant Soren's resignation and demanded a debate on corruption.

363.title: Delhi govt to start 'Doctor on Wheels' scheme for construction workers
363.article_body: Delhi government on Monday announced 'Doctor on Wheels' scheme for construction workers under which they will be offered routine health check-ups. As per the official statement, the government will also launch unique 'mobile creches' for children of these workers at sites, where they will get better day-care facilities. The Delhi government is running 17 welfare schemes for construction workers.

364.title: Reserve Bank of Australia hikes rate to 6-year high of 1.85%
364.article_body: In a first, the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) on Tuesday hiked its benchmark interest rate for four months in a row by 0.5% points to a six-year high of 1.85%. RBA Governor Philip Lowe said the increase in interest rates was because of the "high priority" to return inflation to the 2-3% range over time.

365.title: Priyanka Chopra breaks down as she meets Ukrainian refugees, shares video
365.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, who is on a visit to Poland to meet Ukrainian refugees, shared a video of her interaction with the women and children, who were forced to leave their homes. One clip shows the children giving her handmade dolls and another clip shows her breaking down on hearing the refugees' stories. Priyanka is a global goodwill ambassador with UNICEF.

366.title: Weightlifter Punam Yadav misses out on CWG medal after 3 failed clean & jerk attempts
366.article_body: Indian weightlifter Punam Yadav missed out on a medal at CWG 2022 after three failed clean and jerk attempts during her women's 76-kg event. Punam, who bagged gold medal at CWG 2018 and a bronze medal at CWG 2014, had lifted 98 kg in snatch. She failed to successfully lift 116 kg in all of her clean and jerk attempts.

367.title: I fight mindsets: Kangana on Karan Johar's 'Hindi downmarket' remark
367.article_body: Reacting to filmmaker Karan Johar sharing in his biography that he considered Hindi as "downmarket", actress Kangana Ranaut wrote on Instagram, "I don't fight individuals, I fight mindsets." "To a large extent, I've fought this prejudice against small Hindi-speaking people," added Kangana. Karan Johar had shared in his biography that he didn't like producer Aditya Chopra as he spoke Hindi.

368.title: N Korean hackers faking resumes to get jobs at US crypto firms: Report
368.article_body: North Korean hackers are reportedly browsing job sites like LinkedIn and Indeed and stealing information from legitimate profiles to build plagiarised resumes to get jobs at US cryptocurrency firms. A report said that the hackers are securing employment at these companies in order to raise funds for the North Korean government.

369.title: 81 Chinese nationals given 'Leave India' notice during 2019-21: Govt
369.article_body: The Lok Sabha was informed on Tuesday that 81 Chinese nationals were given 'Leave India' notice while 117 others from that country were deported for violating visa conditions and other illegal acts during 2019 to 2021. As many as 726 Chinese nationals were placed in 'adverse list' for violating visa conditions and other illegal acts, Union Minister Nityanand Rai said.

370.title: Oommen Chandy becomes longest serving MLA in Kerala Assembly
370.article_body: Congress leader and ex-Kerala CM Oommen Chandy became the longest serving MLA in the state Assembly by completing 51 years and over three months. He broke the existing record in the name of former Kerala Congress (M) supremo late KM Mani. Chandy represented only Puthuppally in the past five decades. He became the MLA at the age of 27.

371.title: SC seeks govt's response on pleas over CBI, ED chiefs' tenure extension
371.article_body: SC on Tuesday sought the Centre's response on the petitions challenging the ordinances passed in November 2021 for the extension of the tenure of CBI & ED chiefs by up to five years. The petitions allege that amendments were brought to extend the tenure of ED director Sanjay Kumar Mishra. CJI NV Ramana is heading the bench hearing the pleas.

372.title: Govt to fill over 84,000 vacancies in armed forces by Dec 2023: MoS Rai
372.article_body: The central government has decided to fill up existing vacancies in the armed forces by December 2023, MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said on Tuesday. He informed that there were a total of 84,659 vacancies in the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) and Assam Rifles till July 31, 2022. Of these, the maximum (27,510) were in CRPF, he added.

373.title: Monekypox isn't a new disease, don't panic: Union Health Minister
373.article_body: Amid a rise in monkeypox cases, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday advised people to not panic and said that the awareness programmes are being run in collaboration with state governments. "When cases started appearing in...world, India had already started preparations," he added. Furthermore, he said that monkeypox "isn't a new disease" in India and in the world.

374.title: Gold prices marginally down in India, hit 4-week high globally
374.article_body: Gold prices in India were trading marginally lower on Tuesday with gold October futures down by ₹96 at ₹51,530 per 10 gram at the Multi Commodity Exchange. Silver September futures fell ₹256 to ₹58,070 per kg. Meanwhile, gold hit a four-week high globally as a weaker dollar and a dip in US Treasury yields bolstered its demand.

375.title: 3-year-old twins joined at the brain separated using virtual reality in Brazil
375.article_body: A pair of twins who were conjoined at the head have been successfully separated with the help of virtual reality in Brazil. The three-year-old boys underwent seven surgeries, involving over 27 hours of operating time in the final operation alone, and almost 100 medical staff. They are now able to look at each other for the first time.

376.title: Manpreet Kaur qualifies for women's shot put final at CWG 2022
376.article_body: Manpreet Kaur has qualified for the women's shot put final at the Commonwealth Games 2022. Kaur qualified with a throw of 16.78m and was ranked seventh overall in the qualifying rounds. Jamaica's Danniel Thomas-Dodd topped the qualifying rounds with a throw of 18.42m. The automatic qualifying mark was 18m in the event.

377.title: BJP's eyes blindfolded with ego; can't see rising inflation: Rahul
377.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for rising inflation by sharing a chart of increases in prices of eight basic commodities. "BJP went on to claim in the Parliament that there is no inflation in India. Anyways, how will they see rising inflation? Their eyes are blindfolded with ego," Rahul tweeted.

378.title: PMC approves ₹6.24 crore for machine cleaning of public toilets
378.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved ₹6.24 crore for the cleaning of public and community toilets via jetting machines. "PMC used to clean public toilets manually. Following complaints over cleanliness, the civic body has decided to use jetting machines...Zonal officers will float tender, hire agency and handle the project," PMC's Solid Waste Management Department head Asha Raut said.

379.title: Actor Prabhas has weird purity in his eyes: Actress Kriti Sanon
379.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said she would "love" to work with her 'Adipurush' co-star Prabhas again. "He has some weird purity in his eyes...he is one of those people whose eyes are really expressive and very deep and there is something very pure," she added. Filmmaker Om Raut is the director of 'Adipurush'.

380.title: Anupam Kher joins cast of Ravi Teja-starrer 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'
380.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher announced on Monday that he has joined the cast of actor Ravi Teja's upcoming film 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'. "My 528th film is Telugu one with great talent in every department," Kher wrote on Instagram while sharing his look from the film. The film is based on a notorious thief and is set in Andhra Pradesh's Stuartpuram village.

381.title: 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening, will go on floors next year: Alia Bhatt
381.article_body: Alia Bhatt has said that 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening and will go on the floors next year. The film will also feature Priyanka Chopra and Katrina Kaif. "Of course, we cannot go on the floor this year. We ain't letting that film go. We are fighting for it and we are all too excited about it," the actress added.

382.title: US to send $550 million worth of new weapons to Ukraine
382.article_body: The US has announced an additional $550 million in military aid to Ukraine.  The new package will include more ammunition for the High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) and 75,000 rounds of 155mm artillery ammunition, US Defence Department said. "We remain committed to providing Ukraine with the capabilities they need to defend their homeland," US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said.

383.title: Woman throws slipper at Partha Chatterjee while being taken to ED office
383.article_body: A woman threw a slipper at former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee today while he was being taken to the ED office from central government-run hospital near Kolkata. "I had come to throw my slipper on him. He has taken money from poor people. I would have been happier if the slipper would have hit him on his head," she said.

384.title: UK PM candidate Truss to scrap plans to restrict junk food deals
384.article_body: Liz Truss, the leading contender to become UK's next PM, said she will scrap plans to restrict multi-buy deals on unhealthy foods. In an interview, Truss said Britons don't want the government telling them what to eat. In May, UK delayed plans to ban 'buy one get one free' offers on junk food due to cost-of-living crisis.

385.title: Mahua Moitra releases pics with '₹1.5 lakh bag' amid criticism she hid it in Parliament
385.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has shared photos showing her with her bag on different occasions in the Parliament complex. This comes after she was criticised for allegedly trying to hide the bag, which reports claimed was priced over ₹1.5 lakh, during a debate on inflation. She tweeted, "Jholewala fakir in Parliament since 2019. Jhola leke aye the...jhola leke chal padenge..."

386.title: Karan Johar knows cinema, understands dynamics of filmmaking minutely: Azmi
386.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi, speaking about her experience while filming for 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', has said that she was amazed at filmmaker Karan Johar's understanding of the craft. Karan is the director of the film. "Karan is a director who knows cinema and understands the dynamics and nuances of filmmaking minutely," she further added.

387.title: Bajaj Auto two-wheeler sales drop by 5% in July to 3.15 lakh units
387.article_body: Bajaj Auto on Monday reported a 5% fall in its total two-wheeler sales at 3,15,054 units in July 2022 as against 3,30,569 units in the corresponding period last year. While domestic two-wheeler sales rose by 5% to 1,64,384 units, exports fell by 14%. The commercial vehicle sales rose by 3% with 39,616 units sold against 38,547 units in July 2021.

388.title: Pelosi's Taiwan visit will undermine US-China relations: China
388.article_body: Chinese Ambassador to UN, Zhang Jun, has said that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit would undermine the relationship between China and the US. "Such a visit is apparently very much dangerous and provocative," Zhang said during a news conference. Zhang also urged Washington to honour the one-China principle. US said it will not be intimidated by China's warnings.

389.title: SpiceJet clears all pending dues with Airports Authority of India
389.article_body: SpiceJet entered into an agreement with the Airports Authority of India (AAI) and cleared all outstanding principal dues of the airport operator. In 2020, the AAI had put SpiceJet on a ‘cash and carry’ basis for the failure to clear its previous dues. Under this model, an airline has to make payments to the AAI for various charges every day.

390.title: Had to play dad to 20-year-old, I thought 'F*** you': Colin on 1st older role
390.article_body: Actor Colin Farrell said that he almost took offence when he was offered his first older role. "I do remember first time I got script where I was playing father of someone who was 20 and I thought, 'F*** you'. I realised it was an absolutely inappropriate offer to make," he said, adding that he's having fun in his 40s.

391.title: Nigerian national in Delhi tests positive for monkeypox, 3rd case in national capital
391.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported its third confirmed case of monkeypox. This comes after a 31-year-old man from Nigeria, admitted to the Lok Nayak Hospital, tested positive for the virus. "India currently has eight confirmed cases of monkeypox. Out of the eight patients, five have a history of foreign travel," Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said.

392.title: 6 Army jawans booked in Raj after man admitted by them to hospital dies
392.article_body: An FIR has been registered against six Army jawans in Rajasthan after a 24-year-old man whom they had admitted to a hospital in Pokhran died, police said. The man and his friend had gone to the prohibited firing range in Pokhran on a motorcycle. The man's family claimed that he was caught by the jawans who thrashed him badly.

393.title: Wanted younger actress for Kareena's role, would've been mistake: Aamir on 'Laal...'
393.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has stated that the team was originally looking for a younger actress for Kareena Kapoor's role in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "That was a mistake we were making," he added. Aamir said they were looking at a video of another actor and accidentally saw Kareena in it. "Since she wasn't 25, we didn't think of her," he said.

394.title: Any experimentation should be avoided: Rajkumar on Suryakumar opening
394.article_body: Reacting to batter Suryakumar Yadav opening the innings in the T20I series against West Indies, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "This is a huge experiment." "Any experimentation involving him should be avoided," added Rajkumar. Discussing the decision to send Suryakumar as an opener, ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth stated, "Please don't do that...Don't spoil the cricketer."

395.title: NMMT introduces buses for Bhiwandi from Navi Mumbai's Airoli
395.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) has introduced a new bus route to Thane's Bhiwandi from Airoli in Navi Mumbai. The bus service started on Monday (August 1) and frequency of the service is 25 to 30 minutes, as per reports. The places that come in the new route are Airoli, Thane, Majiwada, Bhiwandi Bypass and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Chowk.

396.title: Oppo, Vivo India & Xiaomi served notices for alleged tax evasion: Sitharaman
396.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed Rajya Sabha that three Chinese mobile companies- Oppo, Vivo India and Xiaomi have been served notices for alleged tax evasion by them. She said, while Oppo has been sent a notice for total customs duty of ₹4,389 crore, three show-cause notices have been issued to Xiaomi for an approximate duty liability of about ₹653 crore.

397.title: I sacrificed stardom to get freedom to cater to audience I wanted: Abhay
397.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol has stated that he had to sacrifice his stardom to be allowed the freedom to cater to the audience he wanted. He said that he was told to take advantage of the image of the Deol family. "Even though I did the films I did, it's difficult to...be constantly pushing because...filmmaking is a collective process," Abhay added.

398.title: Disappointing to lose film to A-lister who didn't even audition: Harleen
398.article_body: Actress Harleen Sethi stated that it's disappointing to lose a Bollywood film to an A-lister after being locked for six months. "I...get messages from directors saying, 'It was the best audition and you were the closest'," she said. The actress added that it happened recently when an A-lister got her part without even giving an audition or a look test.

399.title: Telecom sector may see ₹2-3 trillion investment in next 2 yrs: Vaishnaw
399.article_body: Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said India's telecom industry is likely to see investment of ₹2-3 trillion in next two years as reforms by the government have removed uncertainty and risks. "It's going to be significant investment by the industry," he said. Vaishnaw added that he's sure that the trend of affordable services will continue as operators start launching 5G services.

400.title: 99% of Florida's turtles born female due to hotter summers: Study
400.article_body: According to study, 99% of turtles born in Florida in the past four years have turned out to be female, thanks to hotter summers. According to researchers, the sex of sea turtles depends on temperature of developing eggs. If a turtle's egg is incubated below 27.7°C, the hatchling will be male, but if it's incubated above 31°C, it'll be female.

401.title: 2 held for theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 cr in Mumbai, 1 absconding
401.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested two diamond brokers, Bharat Kandol and Amrut Bhai Patel, in connection with the theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 crore, an official said on Monday. The mastermind behind the crime, Kaushik Chovatila, is absconding, the official added. The accused allegedly contacted a diamond merchant, expressing interest in purchasing diamonds, after which they stole the stones.
